"Have a nice chat with your 'brother', then? Here to convince me that that hellcat has 'seen the Divines and is ready to turn over a new leaf?"
you try not to gulp too loudly. In the back of your mind you know that this is just part of the game mechanics and that you're not really intimidated by the fat official in front of you. At least, you hope so.

"Well?"

You shake yourself out of the state you were in, try to make yourself as tall as you can, and look the jailer square in the eyes. "Yes. And I call her brother out of respect for her and my father. He wanted a son, and so she was raised to be no different than any man."

"Did that include rampant theft, mayhem, and resisting arrest that resulted in the destruction of three market stalls and sent several merchants, civilians and most importantly my fellow guardsmen to the healers? And you both seemed to enjoy that kiss far more than any brother or sister should, especially given that she's a Nord and you're an Imperial." The jailer says in a calm, voice that seems to carry down through the cell block as he calls your bluff, and you feel your sense of bravado vanish in an instant.

You stand there sputtering like an idiot before the guard grabs you by the scruff of your scruffy neck and hauls you out of the cell block. You hear your brother's voice ring out over the sudden clamor of the other prisoners, but you can't tell what he's saying before you're through back at the prison entrance, with the large wooden door closing with a heavy thud against it's frame. Suddenly you're pushed forward towards a chair and you barely manage to catch yourself on it.

"Sit" The jailer says from behind you and you hear his audible weight settling on his own chair. Your mind races for a plan, but the guard repeats the command and you feel compelled to follow it, feeling like a school child who just got reprimanded in front of the entire class as the jailer fixes you with a hard stare.

"Now, whoever that woman is to you, she's broken enough of the Emperor's laws to have herself beheaded or hanged in public. But since she has caught several criminal scum for us in the past, the magistrates have seen fit to merely confine her to a cell until the middle of Frostfall. After which she'll be shipped back to Skyrim where she belongs, with penalty of death if she ever steps foot inside Cyrodil again"

'The middle of Frostfall? How long is that? What is it now?' You ask yourself, and instantly you know. Sun's Height, the Tamrielic analogue of July. Your brother was going to be stuck in this place for three months. And then exiled. Ryan was going to be pissed whenever you told him.

"Of course, I could be willing to consider time served on account for...'good behavior' " The jailer said as his bulbous lips twisted into a lecherous smirk. "She'll still be sent back to Skyrim, but I'm sure that a four days in prison is better than four months..."

You can't believe what you're hearing from an NPC from a video game. The level of detail was amazing and it was almost like you were speaking with a living, breathing person! Failed speech check or not, this experience had been nothing short of amazing.

"I've let your 'brother' know the terms of my deal, but until she sees reason I've no choice but to abide fully by the orders of the magistrates. Until then, I suggest that you do not come back here, or I'll take it as an attempt to help her escape, and you, a peasant, have no immunity from that punishment" The jailer reaches up to his neck with a pudgy hand and scratches under his second chin; a swift horizontal movement whose message is very clear to you.

"I'll send a messenger for you here in the city when she's being exiled to Skyrim. Or if something happens to her." The jailer raps on his desk with a pudgy fist twice, and the two guards from outside rush in instantly and grab you under both arms.

"Until then, good day, citizen"

You feel yourself hauled upwards adn backwards out of the flimsy wooden chair and the bright light of day temporarily blinds you as you're suddenly cast into the air, landing moments later on the hard cobblestone street. Pain flairs up and down your body but you climb back to your feet and dust yourself off. No broken bones in this body, but you're not looking forward to what your brother has planned when you both log off. Until you get your own, you realize that this could very well be your first and last chance to play in virtual Tamriel.
You could always go adventuring on your own...Maybe your brother would appreciate it more it you busted him out of jail in grand fashion?
11211122.title: Level Zeros Are No Heroes

112111221.content:
"Man, forget that nonsense!" You say, drawing odd looks from other Imperial citizens as give the strange mumbling peasant a wide berth, "Ryan's just going to kick me out of his room and I'll never get the chance to do this again! Besides, it's just a game..."You wander the streets of the Imperial City, taking in the sights and leveling up your more mundane skills. You're getting better and better at stealing things, although you're still a long way off from even being a amateur thief. Eventually you find yourself back at the chapel where you started, with a very distraught monk practically throwing himself at you the moment he spots you.

"OH THANK THE EMPEROR YOU'RE BACK!" The monk cries out in joy, and after you pry yourself from the arms of the older man you see that he was almost moved to tears.

'Wow, old guy takes his job seriously' you think to yourself as the monk quickly straightens his robes and takes a deep breath before fixing you with the same serious look as before, he opens his mouth to speak...

"Dude, I accept. Just tell me where I need to go next, and where I can get some decent clothes?"

You try not to laugh as the old man seems to deflate, and you almost feel sorry for him as he sighs and hands you a crisp scroll before wandering away around the nearby corner. You shake off the feeling and tear off the scroll's wax seal as excitement and adrenaline fills your body and you forget about your brother's predicament entirely.

Your first quest, this is so cool!
112111221.title: Go adventuring!

1121112211.content:
It did not take long to realize that the first few quests seemed to be tied to each other.

The First quest had you looking for some lost relic of Malog Bal. (For the first quest you received, is was horrifically tough... took you two damn months to complete it.) (The relic was a pendent of all things.)

The second quest, given by the same guy, was to find the lost jewel of Malog Bal. (You see the pattern here right? Luckily, by the power of level grinding, this quest only took a single month.)

Now your own the third and final quest of chain. You had to locate a long forgotten shrine to Malog Bal and use the pendent and jewel to receive the princes blessing.

This of course explains why you had to fight your way through monster horde after monster horde and had to take on no less then three fucking dragons.

Why kind of chain of starter quest has a person fight three dragons at once?

Finally you reached the end of your quest (Maybe) as you come to the last room of an real old, highly elaborate ruin... which just so happened to have the alter you were looking for.

It was at this point things went south.

"Finally, I thought that you would never get here." The familiar voice of the quest giver guy, you never learned his name, called out, "We can't preform the ritual without our sacrifice."

"Fuck!" You scream as you are suddenly attacked by a bunch of guys in clocks.

Dodging and parrying, slashing and thrusting your way through the horde of mooks was a tiring trial. Especially as your health points were getting dangerously low.

Not to mention quest giver guy kept yelling at the mooks to kill you.

Funny that he died in one hit.

Not so funny was that he himself qualified as a sacrifice.

The last thing you remember was the rest of the mooks falling over dead and the pendent and jewel glowing with unspeakable energies.

Then the world went black.

You make it just in time to see the ship disapear over the horrizen
11211122111.content:
"What happened?" You ask when you finally come to.

You were still in the ritual room and the bodies of all the mooks still surrounded you. Suddenly a notice screen appears in front of you.

[Congratulations for receiving the first blessing of Malog Bal, [Beyond Limit].

[Beyond Limit] grants a permanent plus ten boost to all attributes, to be added after original values. (This allows your max value in any attribute to be MAX + 10)

You ran back to the Imperial City as fast as you could but even with your new boost in abilities it still took you three days to get there.

Running to the prison area as fast as you could you made an official request to see the warden.

"What can I do for you citizen?" The head warden asked from behind his desk.

"I believe that a friend of mine is being held here. I would like to negotiate for her release." You reply easily, your voice filled with confidence. "She is a nordic women, a good fighter overall but has a tendency to get into trouble."

"Ah her..." The head warden said as her rubbed his forehead, "Sadly for you she was taken just this morning for causing too much trouble."

"That sounds like her alright." you say, bringing your own palm up to rub your head, fostering a sense of comrade between you and the warden. "I take it that she has been sent to her homeland already then?" You ask, wanting to get confirmation.

The warden opens his mouth and, "It was decided that she was to be sent to..."

Back to Skyrim

or

Sold to Slavers to pay off the debts she owes.
112111221112.title: Missed it by that much

1121112212.content:
You swing your mace and smile grimly as the orc's skull caves in and the heavily armored enemy collapses to the cold dirt. You spit on the ground near the orc's head and then wince as the action pulls at the wounds you'd sustained in the fierce battle. You could feel your heart pound in your chest the color had begun to drain from the edges of your vision, and the various arrows sticking out of your heavy armor suddenly felt like their archers had found their marks after all.
You take a deep breath and feel the magicka pool around you. With effort, you push both of your sore hands together and focus the energies into a powerful healing spell, and suddenly your body no longer feels near death. With your injuries heal, you get down to what had quickly become one of your favorite parts of the game: Looting.

You had no idea how long you had been playing, once you had gotten the first short questline out of the way and were outfitted with your first set of proper armor, you'd stopped trying to keep track. Everything was so real, and there was just no getting over the adrenaline that pitched battle seemed to bring. Before you knew it you had already killed several rampaging dragons that had broken away from the Paarthurnaax's enclave to the north, romanced several barmaids and had faced enough giant spiders that you're pretty sure that you'd either conquered your arachnophobia, or made it a hundred times worse, you werent' sure. And then there had been this particularly epic fight in the mountains above Markarth, and from your vantage point on the peak you could see the trail of orc and Reachmen bodies scattered in their makeshift war camp. It had been a challenging fight, but so worth it.

You pull the armor off of the orc and set it aside while you pull your own armor off. Imperial plate had nothing against the exotic, bulky, and somewhat glowy orcish armor the warlord had been wearing. The outdated Imperial armor was probably the reason why you had almost died, but now you had a feeling you'd be unstoppable for the time being. Daedric armor was your goel, but you still had a ways to go before you could wear it. You finish looting the warlord and the nearby chest and end up tossing away your old boots and even your trusty mace in exchange for a larger hammer that was covered in runes and filled your muscled arms with an ethereal power that seemed familiar to the shrine of Molag Bal so long ago. It had been a good fight and a even better haul.

Slowly but steadily you make your way down the mountain towards the distant city below. This would be your first time in Skyrim and you were excited to see what...

You stop in your tracks. Skyrim. You were in Skyrim. The place where they were going to send your brother after he got out of prison. The prison your were supposed to rescue him from. You think for a moment, trying to figure out how long you'd been adventuring, how many times you'd sped time forward by sleeping.
Eventually a date crawls into your mind.

24th of Evening Star. Four days after the invocation of Molag Bal, the daedric prince you'd selected over six in-game months ago as your patron god. And two months after your brother was supposed to be exiled back to her 'home' province.

You unsling your pack and rifle through the pile of letters you had received from various messengers. Not a single one of them had anything to do with your brother being released from prison, whether by waiting it out or by taking the other...option that was available to her. And then you recall what the jailer had said.

"I'll send a messenger for you here in the city when she's being exiled to Skyrim. Or if something happens to her."

You'd never gone back to the Imperial City after you'd left following the quest line and then getting lost in the endless adventure that this game had provided. And since you'd never gone back to the city, the game never sent you a message. You'd essentially abandoned your brother to fend for herself. A cold dread, colder than the mountain air and snow combined, crept over your body as you forced yourself down the mountain and into Skyrim.

It was time to finish your personal quest.
1121112212.title: The Elder Scrolls Effect

11211122121.content:
15th of First Seed.

You stare at the inn at the edge of town. It had taken you months to cross the massive province of Skyrim, searching every city, every town, every settlement for signs of your brother. With player tracking not being built into the game's programming nor this being a built in quest, you'd had to scrounge up information the old way by talking with NPCs and tracing leads, many of which had either lead you to dungeons for some side quest or simply went nowhere. You'd expected Ryan to make a name for herself as an adventurer in Skyrim, but there had been no tales of a beautiful warrior woman fighting the evils of the land. No tales of someone even claiming to be a man in a woman's body (Well, aside from the NPCs that had been zapped by the Wabbajack), or some angry woman just muttering about how her brother left her to die in prison. You'd even gone back to the Imperial City, only to find out that a random event had generated a riot a month ago and ended with the prison, the jailer and almost all of the records going up in flames.

So you had come back to Skyrim, and while lodging in Whiterun had heard about a 'Dibella blessed' tavern wench on the far distant island of Solstheim. The one place that you'd forgotten about since playing Skyrim years ago. An isolated island that had been under the control of the first Dragonborn, but had been freed by another Dragonborn. In the time since the general main events of Skyrim, Solstheim had changed little. It was still largely covered in ash and it was still largely in control of the Dunmer, but the Imperials had re-established their presence on the island and was once again subject to Imperial and Skyrim law. And while this 'Dibella blessed' tavern wench was nothing more than the ramblings of a drunkard, it had been the one place in Skyrim that you had failed to look.
And now you were here. Your newish dwarven armor was coated in ash that was rapidly being replaced by snow as you stood in center of the small Skall village, having been directed there by the Dunmer and later, the Nords at the Thirsk mead hall had directed you towards the Skaal. The Skaal village had grown since you had last been here in the Dragonborn expansion for Skyrim, but it was still very small in comparison to most other villages you'd seen in Tamrie so far. It was still quite rustic, and the locals were not exactly being subtle about watching your every movement with suspicion. You took a deep breath of the cold, but not horribly cold, air and stepped forward into the inn.

It was quiet inside, as you had expected. There were only two patrons that you could see, both sitting around the fire pit, their eyes following your every movement even as they drank from their large mugs. The innkeeper appeared to be busy readying the bar for the coming night, but even as he rearranged flasks of mead and check cleaned the nearby tables you could tell he was watching you as well. He made his way back to the long oak wood bar as you approached, a wary look in his eyes as he grasped a nearby rag and began scrubbing the inside of a mug.

"Hello stranger, welcome to the Skaal inn. Can I get you anything? Maybe a warm drink before you get back on the road?" His tone of voice and the words he used made it obvious, he didn't want you here. But you were a player, and you were no longer the buffoon who couldn't pass a speech check. You laid a heavy gauntleted arm on the bar and leaned in.

"I want to speak to your bar maid" you said, your voice low, almost conspiratorial, but you could feel the power behind them. The irony that you were finally using your inherent abilities that your brother had planned out was not lost on you as you eyed the innkeeper as he looked you over, his eyes falling on the massive daedric axe that you had strapped to your back. His face blanched and you knew that you had him, long ago you had figured out that the game no longer simply did speech checks based on your speech skill. Instead the game was programmed to take into account the appearance of the character, the tone of voice used, and body and facial language. In essence, you truly had to be persuasive or intimidating for a speech check to work. If only you had known that when you tried to fast talk the jailer back in Imperial City.

"Uh, may I, Uh, ask why?" The innkeeper stammered, his programming obviously trying to maintain the appearance of negotiating when you already knew he would do what you wanted. You simply shrugged in your armor, the clank of the heavy dwarven plates and the creak of leather as your muscled frame flex within them.

"I'd appreciate the company"

"I...uh, I see. Just give me a, uh, one moment sir, please"

And with that the innkeeper hurriedly disappeared down into the cellar storerooms, where most of the inn staff typically lived at. You cast a glance towards the two patrons around the fire pit, and they quickly turned their attention fully to their mugs. You smiled inside your helmet, even after what had been almost a full year in this game you were still blown away by how realistic it all was.

You heard the creak of the storeroom door open and slow footfalls on the stairs. Soon you'd know if you'd found your brother or not.

A crest of brilliant blonde hair rose up from behind the bar and as the body it belonged to came into full view, your eyes went wide.
It was Ryan all right, but instead of the fierce warrior woman you'd been expecting (along with the eventual punch to the face), instead the woman before you was clad in a long flowing dress that still barely contained her breasts and curves. Especially the shockingly large one on her lower abdomen which was cradled protectively by two slender arms that contained none of the muscle mass that they had in prison. Her eyes were full of discomfort and worry, but still as blue as your remembered. She fixed your full-faced helmet with a stare and glanced backwards at the innkeeper who helped her up off of the last of the stairs.

This was Ryan...but it couldn't be, could it? How could it be?

Your thoughts were interrupted by the innkeeper as he stepped forward and presented her to you with a slight bow of his head.

"Sir, this is my bar maid, Reianne. I hope that she meets with your satisfaction. Now if you'll excuse me, my other patrons needs some refills"The innkeeper hurried away towards the fire pit, leaving you and the woman that was your brother alone by the counter. She fixed you with that same worried stare and you could not take your eyes off the large bulge that had taken residence where there had once been powerful female abs. And then she spoke.

"S...sir? I know my appearance might be misleading, but I am still capable of giving you...company. May I see your face, so that I may know you better?" Her voice was soft, light, radically different than the husky voice that you had last heard in the Imperial prison. Your mind was just completely blown, it was all so much, so fast, and your epic personal quest had just been thrown a plot twist.

"I uh, well..." You stammer as you try to find the words. Your hands seem to find their way towards the clasps of your helmet but you suddenly force them away and look around the tiny inn. "Is there, uh, any place private we could go first? It's been a long, lonely road and the sooner I can find a proper bed, the better"

Crestfallen is the only word that properly describes the expression of her face, and she points back towards the stairs. "I...suppose we can use my room, if you'd like? You will have to help me however, sir, I am afraid that stairs are as dangerous to me right now as any bandit"

You nod dumbly and take her hand in your armor plated ones, and slowly but surely you make your way downstairs, holding your brother's fragile form as delicately as you could before she leads you to a spacious room behind the wine casks. In one corner was a large bed, but to your surprise was fitted with actual cushions and cloth as opposed to the straw beds you'd seen in so many other inns. There was a large dresser in the other corner, and a table with several chairs next to it, with a vase filled with colorful flowers sitting directly in the center. In the far corner was a basin with jugs of water and what looked to be fresh cloth wrappings and other delicate, womanly things.

Your brother leads you to the bed and slowly settles down upon it, her eyes locking with you once more.
"
Please, sir, you must disrobe. Otherwise I am afraid that you may have to find company elsewhere"

The moment that you've been both hoping for and dreading for a in-game year is finally here, though you just cannot believe the circumstances it has occurred under. Your hands slide back up to the clasps in your helmet, and for what seem like the first time in forever, you slide it off.

Ryan's blue eyes open wide as she...
11211122121.title: Finding Ryan

112111221211.content:
"Michael?"

You brace yourself for the coming punch and close your eyes for the reprisal, but nothing ever comes. Instead you small arms slide around your armored bulk and
you look down in the crown of blonde hair.

"Oh Mike, I was so worried! I thought that you'd died!"

"But..." you stammer, but you're cut off as your brother...sister begins crying into your armor. You stand there for a few moments as she hugs you as tight as she can before you gently push her away. This is no way to do this. She looks up at you with a look of confusion and fear in her eyes, the watery blue orbs darting from you to the door, telegraphing that she's terrified that you're going to leave.

But you don't. Instead you undo the rest of the clasps in your armor and let the pieces clatter to the floor noisily and though you still tower over her, you at least seem a little less intimidating. At least you think, though you know that you have your fair share of scars and other war wounds that have been both admired and hated by NPC women. You stand there sheepishly in your undershirt and pants and give Ryan a weak grin, and she chuckles before hugging you once more.
She soft and warm and almost weightless to your hulking warrior form, and you can't help but feel your cock stiffen as her breast push up against you. But then you feel the pregnant bulge and as gently as you can, you pick her up and lay her on the bed. She gives you a strange look that quickly passes as you settle next to her on the side of the bed. Your eyes look her up and down before you point at her stomach.

"Ryan, what happened?"

She stares at you as if you just asked the dumbest question on the planet. "What do you mean 'what happened'? I took the jailer's offer after you left. It was either that or risk catching plague in that filthy pit. YOU never came back, and they couldn't find you in the city, so they sent me 'home'. Except my crimes followed me here."

You blink in confusion at her words. You never had found out the whole story as to why she had been thrown in jail in the first place. Ryan rolled her eyes and sighed dramatically, like how your mother sighed when your father did something dumb.

"It means that although the Imperials gave me a pardon, they also wanted to make sure that the exile was enforced. As since Nords value honor...well, you can imagine that not many people wanted to hire an ex-con. So I spent a couple of months waiting for YOU to show up in Whiterun, working in the Drunken Huntsman letting some damn elf fondle my ass before I finally was showing too much for him to ignore. And then I got kicked out, and let's just say there's as much a stigma against unwed pregnant women here as there is back home"

You take notice that she didn't say 'the real world', but let her continue.

"I used what gold to travel around looking for another job, but at that point I was showing too much that no one wanted a 'spoiled' bar maid" She spit the last words out like they were poison, "And then I remembered Solstheim. It was isolated, out of the way, I figured that maybe if I could just get away from the collective mass of ignorance that maybe, just maybe, I could live a comfortable life."

"Well, I'm here now, we can just log out. I mean, it sounds like this character has been ruined for you...So we can just start over! We'll roll some fresh characters and go fight some dragons or something!" You say hopefully, but the sad look on her face fills you with instant dread.

"Mike...I can't. Something in the game broke, I tried logging out as soon as you got dragged away from me in the prison. That's what I was yelling at you, to log out so I could kick your butt, but I couldn't. And when I took the jailer's deal, well...I think I became part of the game" There was a long silence as you stared at one another, your mind racing at what Ryan was implying. It was impossible. It had to be impossible. Didn't they take something like this into account when they made the game? They had to! Imagine the lawsuits they be getting because of this...And even worse how would mom and dad react?

"Ryan, I..." You start, but she shakes her head sadly.

"It's Reianne now, Mike. You saw the 'act' earlier, except it isn't really an act. It's just who I am now, just who the game expects and demands that I be. I can't explain it, it's just this...compulsion. I suppose that when I took the deal and it changed me from a player to a NPC. You see how weak looking I am, it's part of what happened. As soon as they dropped me off at Falkreath I started losing skill points until I leveled out here. I think I'm like level five right now if now lower. But I can't pick up weapons and fight, I even tried to leave Skyrim to find you, but I couldn't. And right now, I'm attracted to you even though you're my brother. Or were. It's just who I am now"

You leap up from the side of the bed and begin pacing around the room. "This is impossible!" You shout, to which Ryan...Reianne hurriedly shushes you, "This has to be illegal, you can't just BECOME a computer program! This is a VIDEO GAME!"

Reianne fixes you with a sad smile as she pulls herself upright. "Virtual reality tech has it's dangers, Mike. I suppose that in your world, this'll be a case that helps move the technology along. It's not so bad. I'm pretty, I have a job, a home and a nice boss. Solstheim is really laid back, and the locals more or less accept me as one of their own. And I'll be a mom soon. What more could a woman want?"

"But you're NOT a woman! You're not supposed to be pregnant! You're my brother!" You say pleadingly even as she places a small hand on your chest.

"Mike, I've been a woman for almost a year. I've had things that women are instinctively supposed to know put in my head. I don't know how to be a man anymore, and I'm looking forward to meeting and raising my child. You, mom and dad are going to have to let me go."

You stand there as she turns towards the basin and, as gingerly as she can, steps around most of your armor and begins washing her face as if nothing is wrong. But everything is wrong, and you've come too far just to watch your brother become a NPC. A dark idea builds up in your head, you're a champion of Molag Bal. You have the power of persuasion on top of your racial ability. You could make her see reason...But you'll have to wait until tomorrow, you stupidly blew your Voice of the Emperor on the innkeeper, since you were so sure Reianne...Ryan would instantly want to log out. You watch as the woman your brother has become finish cleaning her face and turns to face you.

"I usually fix dinner, but since I'm so close to my due date Veignhar has just let me stay down here so I don't have to climb those damn stairs. He's not as good a cook as I am, but he does his best. You might have to go yell for him to come down here, I'll just tell him you're a old friend and that should make him a little less terrified of you. You really do come off as a bit of a beast in your armor!" She says as she waddles back through the maze of your armor and back to bed.

You nod dumbly and exit back out into the storeroom. As soon as the door closes behind you, your plan solidifies in your mind, and you whisper "I'm not an old friend. I'm your goddamn brother!"
____________________________________________________________________________ _________

You had to admit that dinner was decent. It was at least relaxing, even if Veighnar, the innkeeper, kept giving you nervous glances whenever he thought you couldn't see him. He also seemed to take up a bit of a protective posture, hovering over Ryan...Reianne whenever you got too close. It seemed that the intimidation effect your armor had was slowly wearing off. The older man had cooked some rabbits and though you'd grown used to the taste of less advanced food over the past in-game year, you'd certainly had worse. The inn was, now that you had had time to relax, actually quite cozy, and the inn had had a third room that Veighnar had simply been using as excess storage, but luckily had a spare cot. It was the standard straw affair compared to the actual beds that Reianne and he had, but you'd slept on the cold hard ground enough that you learned to appreciate any kind of bedding.

But you couldn't get over how Reianne...Ryan acted. There was almost no trace of who she had been, the well-meaning, but still sort of an asshole, big brother who had hatched the crazy scheme that had started all this. Small holes of doubt began to appear in your plan. What if Ryan couldn't log out, even if you forced her to?

What if it simply deleted her? What if all you went back to was a mindless body?

What if it worked, and she went back to a body and gender he no longer felt like she belonged in? Not to mention the fact that she seemed genuinely excited about the prospect of being a mother? There was no promise that, if what she said was true and her 'character' was no longer registered as a player, that if she was able to log out, that she'd be able to log in whenever she wanted and pick up this life. Could you really take that away from her?

'But' you hear the dark voice at the back of your mind say as you watch her waddle back into her badroom, 'What if the programming just vanishes when he logs out? What if he's trapped here and the game is trying to keep him trapped? You're his brother, it is your duty to save him!'

As you find your way towards your hastily prepared room, either way, you'll find out tomorrow.
112111221211.title: Recognition & Reconciliation

1121112212112.content:
As always in life, the moment someone has a plan of action things get fucked up.

You were awakened by a horrible scream and instantly know that it is Reianne.

Surprisingly you also hear a bunch of other voices coming from her room.

Reianne was having a baby... Reianne was having a baby right now... Reianne was having a baby right now with complications and in a medieval fantasy setting.

113.content:
Experienz had gone to great lengths to make the virtual holiday feel just like the real thing. The reception area was a large, airy room with a glass facade that resembled the check-in desk of an airport. This led through into a waiting area made to look like the departure's lounge. Michael and his family sat on one of the long benches, waiting for their names to be called over the tanoy.

Damien fidgeted constantly; he was after all, only 5. Tugging at his mother's skirt, he whined plaintively. "Just play with your games machine," Susan sighed exasperated. "We'll be going in in a minute."

"The batteries are dead!" he moaned.

"Then go ask your father if you can play with his phone."

"Oh no," Mark, her husband, said bluntly. "Not again. I've got important clients on there. If he breaks it again..."

"Just give it him, dear," Susan said, and for the next few minutes at least Damien was quiet playing Angry Birds.

Michael played with Rex, his dog, inside his pet carrier, stroking his fur through the bars. Though it was only going to be a short holiday (from the perspective of reality), none of the family had had the heart to put Rex in a dog home for the duration, as he always fretted and worried terribly. Jessica, his twin sister, chatted vacuously on her mobile to her friends. Ryan, Michael's older brother, sat with his head laid back over the top of the seat, his hoodie pulled over his eyes and his earphones in.

"Anderson family, now departing," a feminine voice came over the tanoy. Grabbing their bags and elbowing Ryan in the ribs, the family moved on from the departure lounge.

A peroxide blonde woman in a sky-blue, air hostess uniform greeted them in the next room, which looked more medical that transporational. The room was as stark white as her bleached smile, with a row of what looked like MRI scanners built into one wall. "Hi and welcome to Experienz holiday! Are you ready for the trip of a lifetime?"

"You bet we are!" Mark crowed, rubbing his hands in glee. Even though the virtual experience was far cheaper than conventional holidays, he had still sunk several months pay into it.

"Great! We just need to get your personality chips extracted and then we can begin!" the woman chirruped.

"Uh, this is... safe right?" Michael spoke up hesitantly.

"Absolutely! Experienz holidays is far and away the safest way to travel. In fact it's one hundred percent safe! Technically, we've never had a single fatality!" she bubbled.

""Technically"?"

Her smile wavered a little. "...legally."

"Quit whining, Michael," Ryan grumbled, thumping his brother on the arm.

"Perhaps you'd like a demonstration," the hostess said in a soothing voice and before he could resist she had plucked Rex's carrier from out of his hands. She placed it on one of the long beds inside the MRI-like scanners. Rex began to bark, but she pressed a button on the side of the machine, there was a bright flash of light, and Rex went suddenly silent, slumping limp to the bottom of his carrier. Out of the machine popped a small, plastic card about the size of an SD card. The surface of it was smoking slightly. "Using this neural scanner, we're able to extract the personality of your dog onto a memory card," she explained, removing the card from the machine, holding it carefully between her thumb and forefinger. She carrier it over to an array of hundreds of slots linked to a bank of computers and pushed the card into one of the slots with a secure click. "Then we use this machine to upload his personality into one of our many, custom-built, bespoke simulations that provide him with the most believable, immersive experience available. Over the course of a few days, he can experience weeks of happiness."

"What happens to his body?" Michael asked, worried at the sight of his dog laying so still.

"Ah, that's the best part! We upload personal fitness personalities into all of our bodies for the duration of your stay. While you holiday, they'll be exercising, eating healthily, and undergoing a full detox program. Not only are you getting a vacation, you're getting a tune-up too! When your time is up, we simply reprint your personality back into your body. Believe me, you're going to feel like a new man."

Michael was still concerned but Damien, unwilling to wait any longer, had already clambered into one of the machines and laid down, causing the rest of the family to follow him. Surrendering, Michael laid down with his head inside the body of the machine.

The hostess moved along the row, zapping each family member in turn. When she got to Michael, she leaned down, giving him a view of her ample cleavage, and smiled reassuringly. "Enjoy your trip," she crooned.

Flash!

Red-hot fire seemed to run down every synapse in his body.

Michael 'awoke' to find himself in a gigantic stone room. Before he could ask any question, his twin sister Jessica's voice said beside him, "What is this? A church?"

"That's be one crappy vacation," Ryan said popping up beside Jessica. "Yeah, church is boring." Damien added in a pouty voice.

"Now now Damien," Michael's mother Susan said popped up by Damien and grabbing his hand as she looked around the stone room that seemed to be loading banners and rugs around the room.

"This is no church, this is a castle." Michael's dad Mark said as he saw some thrones pop up at the end of the room.

"Cool!" Damien said running up to the smallest throne and hopping in it.

"So does this mean I'm a real life princess now?" Jessica said trying not to sound too excited. Michael knew she was trying to play it cool, but he knew that being a princess was a dream of hers since she was a little girl, and he had to admit that being a prince did have it's appeal as well.

Suddenly Jessica had a glow about her, and as soon as the glow dissipated Jessica now was wearing flowing white and pink dress made for a princess. Not only that but she seemed to have physically aged a year or two judging by her physical stature.

"It sure looks like it," Mark said as he began to glow. Soon he was dressed like a king, crown included, and now had a bit of a pot belly and a full beard on his face.

One by one the family members went through a wardrobe change that was befitting of a royal family and even had minor physical changes that fit the role. Damien now had long hair, Susan was now covered by so much fine clothing that she seemed to barely have any mobility, and Ryan was now very muscular. Upon seeing this change Michael began getting excited as he soon felt a change and saw the glow surrounding him. He was anticipating a lot more muscles much like Ryan but that didn't seem to be what was changing. As the glow was dying down, before Michael could check himself out, he heard Ryan laughing. "Oh this is rich." Ryan said pointing at Michael.

"What's so funny?" Michael said as he looked at himself and realized very quickly what he was laughing about. Michael wasn't a prince like he'd assumed he was going to be, he was a....

11312.content:
Looking down at yourself, you see a girl apparently in her mid-teens, about 15-16 - roughly the same as your real-world age. You're a little shorter, at a little over 5 feet tall. You have a slim feminine figure, with a thinner waist and slightly wider hips. A pair of breasts are on your chest, looking about a large B-cup. Your hair is jet-black and flows like a waterfall down your back, long enough to touch the floor.

Your clothing is not as elaborate as your mom's or Jessica's, but is clearly just as fine. The dress you're wearing is primarily white, modest, and floor-length. The shoulders have a slight puffiness, while the sleeves get wider towards the end, being about 2 feet wide at the wrist. There is a gold lining on the arms just under the shoulders and on the end of the sleeves.

"Oh wow, you look like me!" Jessica cries excitedly. Though her dress is different, and her hair is shorter, what you can see of yourself does look like her.

"Ha, yeah, you're a princess!" Ryan chuckles.

"What the hell?!" you ask aloud. Your voice is even high and soft, clearly feminine. "What happened?"

Your dad considers, stroking his chin. "I remember... in the contract, it said that our virtual bodies are changed to match the 'game' we're in, and our role in it. It said changes are random, but usually minor, but big ones can happen. Just... bad luck, it looks like."

"Well I don't want to be a princess," you grumble. "Can't we change it? Or make a complaint?"

"I... don't think so," your mom said. "We all signed the agreement. And I don't think changing it is possible."

"So I'm stuck like this?" you complain, pulling at the dress's skirt before dropping it.

A moment later, ornate doors appear on the opposite end of the room as the thrones, then open. A tall man with slick hair and a mustache and fancy clothes appears from behind the opening doors as the rest of the castle is formed. The man enters the room and bows before you and your family.

"Ah, you arrive at last, your Majesties," the man says. "As herald, I bid you welcome." He looks at each member of your family in turn. "King Mark. Queen Susan. Prince Ryan. Princess Jessica. Prince Damien." He looks at you, and seems to freeze for just a moment before saying "Princess... Serenity."

"Serenity?" you ask incredulously. 'That's the name it's using for me?' you think.

The herald ignores your outburst. "I shall go make the announcements, and your stewards and other servants shall arrive shortly. Pardon me." He then turns and walks out the door.

Right after the herald disappears, Rex the dog appears next to you. You squat down and pet him, as he happily licks your hand and wags his tail. 'At least you recognize me and treat me the same,' you think. But Rex starts to glow as well, just like everyone else did.

"Looks like he gets a fantasy form too," your mom says.

"Ooh, what's he gonna be?" Damien asks.
11312.title: Teenage Princess

choices: Arrange a marriage to make allies
113123.content:
With a poof, a reptile the size of your dog stood where Rex was just a moment ago. He licked your hand then started flying circles around you. "Alright, now that's pretty cool," you admit.

Within a few moments your herald returns with a number of other servants, among them a butler who announces dinner will be ready soon, "but first, your Majesties, I advise going to your rooms to relax. I understand you must be stressed after such a long journey." Right, the explanation in-universe for your sudden arrival was that the royal family was returning from a trip to foreign lands.

A maid, your "lady-in-waiting" in fact, showed you to your room, with Rex following behind in flight. It was large and luxurious; filled with everything a princess would want. Except, you weren't sure that you wanted such things. "Er, milady," you said, not sure how to address your own servant, "what is your name again?" "Rochelle, your highness." "Rochelle; could you, ah, help me get ready for dinner?" You were embarrassed to ask, but if you were going to be a princess, you'd need someone to help you navigate things like makeup and dresses; and you were not going to do something as embarrassing as asking your sister for help. She'd never let you live it down. "Of course, your highness!" Your maid exclaimed, and quickly began work doing your hair and makeup.

---

Meanwhile, as King Mark was heading to his room he was stopped by the Royal Chancellor, named Theodore, who explained, "your Majesty, while you were away the Elves delivered an ultimatum; surrender our lands or go to war."

Mark nodded. So this must be what the brochure meant when it promised medieval fantasy politics simulation. "That sounds bad. What can we do?"

"Well sire," the Chancellor replied, "I doubt you wish to give up our kingdom, so I see only two choices. Either we go to war alone, or we arrange a marriage between one of your family to one of the neighboring kingdoms' royal families in order to gain allies. But, you are the King and the decision is yours alone."

Mark was now conflicted. He didn't want to lose the war; who knows how realistic this simulation gets. But, on the other hand, could he really send one (or possibly more) of his children off to be married?
113123.title: A baby dragon

1131231.content:
Mark shrugged. "I suppose we should gain allies; sounds like the most logical thing to do." Ultimately, this was just a VR simulation, and it's not like his children would be under any obligation to consummate their marriages if it came to that. "Who would be the strongest ally?" The chancellor led Mark to an office with a map of the world and explained, "the men to the North, in the Kingdom of Clydesdale, have the largest army by far. The men to the Southeast, in the kingdom of Salisbury lie next to the border of both our land and the Elven Kingdom. I would advise negotiating arrangements with both." Mark nodded, unsure of all this political strategy that was clearly above his pay-grade. "Make it so, then." "Of course sire," the chancellor responded, "I'll send the messengers at once."

---

Sometime later, you came to the dining room for the feast, dressed in fine silks with your hair in a long french braid and your face made up. As you walked in, your sister giggled with excitement. "You look so pretty Micheal! Or, I mean, Serenity." You couldn't help but blush. "I-it's not like I'm enjoying this! But if I'm a princess I have to look the part..." Your brother Ryan busted out in laughter at this. "Ha! I knew it! You just wanted to play dress-up; I bet this wasn't an 'accident' at all 'princess'!" "Now now," your mother interrupted, "it isn't nice to tease. Let's just get through dinner."

As the feast went on, your family returned to lively chatter and mostly forgot about your... gender issues. Your dad, however, was strangely silent with a distant look in his eye. Finally, as dinner came to a close he stood up and made an announcement. "Everyone, I have some information about this simulation that will effect everyone. Apparently, our kingdom will soon be invaded by Elves in some kind of war." With this, everyone exchanged worried looks around the table. Jessica seemed especially nervous. "We don't have to kill do we? And we're not in danger?" Your father bowed his head and replied, "I'm not sure. I hope not. In order to prevent that, I'm going to make alliances with nearby kingdoms. This means I will have to arrange marriages between some of you and their royal families." "WHAT?" Your sister balked at the question. "There has to be another way! Can't we just end the simulation?!" Your father sadly shook his head. "I'm afraid not. We signed a contract stating we'd see this simulation through to it's end." While your sister was starting to cry, your brother began to laugh. "So I get married to some hot princess right? And 'Serenity' here gets a handsome prince? Ha ha, hope you wear your best dress to the wedding Michael!" Your glared at him, angry with everything. Being in medieval times? Fine, you could get used to it. Being a princess? You could make the best of it. But marrying a guy? No way, not your type at all. "This is crazy!" was all you could utter. "Everyone," your father shouted, "calm down. It's just a political marriage; you won't have to do anything you don't want to, and I haven't even met with the other families yet to decide who's marrying who. We still have a week or more before they arrive, according to the chancellor's estimates, so just enjoy yourselves and relax until then."

Returning to your room, you began pacing the floor angrily. "Milady, are you alright?" asked your faithful maid Rochelle. "Alright!" You growled, "how can I be alright! My dad signed us up for this crazy nonsense, and now I might have to marry some stranger! Some... man!" Your lady-in-waiting sighed and placed a hand on your shoulder. "Don't worry milady; I am sure your father has your best interests at heart. Besides, wherever you go I will always be with you, ready to help." You nodded, finally taking in Rochelle for the first time. She was about your age but a bit taller with dark hair and dark skin. Her features were average, but attractive "Thank you Rochelle," you said with a faint smile, "that's very reassuring. And please; call me Mi-" you stopped yourself, remembering your name in this world. "Serenity. Call me Serenity." "As you wish, Lady Serenity. Now please get some rest; you've had a long day." You nodded before she left, and then began undressing and settling into bed, with Rex laying on the foot of your enormous mattress. "Well, I guess it's not all bad. That maid seems nice... and pretty... I wonder..." Your thoughts drifted away as you fell into sleep.
1131231.title: Arrange a marriage to make allies

11312311.content:
The next morning, you were awakened by Rochelle carrying a trey with some pancakes, fruit, and a glass of milk on it "Milady," she started before correcting herself after remembering your earlier conversation, "Serenity, I have brought your breakfast." Breakfast in bed? Finally something good. "Thank you, Rochelle." She nodded as she placed the trey on your lap, then produced a list from her apron and placed it next to you. "This is your daily agenda; Chancellor Theodore believes it important you begin your etiquette training immediately." You almost spit out your milk in response. "Etiquette training?!" you exclaimed, "What does that mean?" "I'm sorry," your lady-in-waiting responded, "but it seems the Chancellor does believe you should learn how to make a proper bride for any potential suitor. I know you don't want to be married, Serenity, but it would help the kingdom. And as I promised; I will be with you all the way for any help you might need." You looked at Rochelle's cheesy but earnest smile as she promised to aid you and couldn't help but smile in return. "Alright, if it means I get to spend more time with you, I'll learn to be the best princess there ever was!" The maid laughed at this and winked, "I believe you are already the greatest princess in the world! But that is only one woman's opinion. Now, finish your food and tell me if you need help getting dressed."

---

Meanwhile, King Mark and Queen Susan were eating breakfast together and arguing about the future. "But I don't understand, Mark! This was supposed to be a vacation so the family could relax and grow closer! Now you want to marry our children off?" Mark sighed and pinched his nose. "Susan, we've discussed this over and over. It's a bad situation but we don't have much of a choice. We can't end the simulation and I have no idea what would happen if our kingdom were to be conquered. Would we be killed? If we die in here do we die in the real world? I don't know and I won't put my family at risk by gambling." Susan bowed her head. "Fine, but I just worry about poor Jessica; she seemed so sad to think about being in an arranged marriage, and poor Micheal has to be married as a bride." Mark nodded glumly. "I worry too; but we have to make do the best we can." The couple finished the rest of their meal in silence.

---

Inside the castle ballroom, you were carefully and slowly walking across the floor in heels with a book on your head; failing miserably at trying not to trip. "Is this really the best way to learn posture?" You asked in a huff. "It seems so cliche'." Meanwhile, Jessica was doing just fine doing the same task. "Seems easy to me Serenity! When can we move on to the task?" "Easy for you," you responded, "because you're already used to wearing heels. Can't I wear royal flats or something?" Rochelle shook her head. "No, you must learn to walk with perfect posture, even in heels, to be considered a proper princess." Jessica couldn't help but giggle at this last statement, which caused you to roll your eyes. She still wasn't used to your being a girl now, but at least her giggles and excitement were more bearable than Ryan's constant teasing. "Well anyway, I'm going to go pet Spike while you figure it out." After another minute, you were still tripping and hopeless. "Gah! I'll never get it," you exclaimed in frustration. "Serenity," Rochelle said softly, "let me help you." You nodded and she stepped up behind you, placing her hands on your waist and back; causing you to blush at her touch as she placed in you into the correct stance. "Now, stand like so," she instructed, "and step forward. Do not move your frame, and step heel to toe." You did as she said, and before you knew it you were walking perfectly. "Wow!" Serenity gasped, "you're walking just like a real girl!" Rochelle gave her a puzzled look. "I mean," your sister backpedaled, "like a proper princess. Because of course you're a girl..." She still wasn't sure how Rochelle would react to hearing this is all VR, and neither were you. The awkwardness was immediately interrupted when Ryan came into the room. "Aww, Princess Serenity getting ready for the ball! Ha ha ha!" You glared at his mockery, and started to respond, but Rochelle came to your defense. "It seems, Prince Ryan, that Princess Serenity is working much harder for the family than you are. Why are you here pestering your siblings when you could be learning the rules of court yourself." "Bah!" was all your brother could offer in response. "Look at me! What princess wouldn't fall in love with me at first sight? I don't need any lessons." Rochelle simply shook her head at him, but said nothing more. Ryan chuckled at her silence, taking it as a victory, and left. "I'm sorry Serenity; I didn't mean to raise my voice at one of the royal family, but something came over me when he mocked you!" You shook your head and placed your hand on her shoulder. "Don't worry Rochelle; I'm actually glad that you have my back. And Ryan's a jerk anyway; you shouldn't ever feel bad raising your voice at him." Rochelle nodded, and then you resumed your lesson.
11312311.title: The next day

113123111.content:
Another couple days had passed; you and your sister continued your etiquette lessons while Ryan continued to laze around and occasionally crack jokes at your expense. It was really starting to get on your nerves; but Rochelle promised she'd be able to get your mind off of it today. When you arrived at the place she told you to meet you were surprised to find Rochelle sitting on a horse. "Serenity!" she called out, "I hope you're ready for your next lesson." Your eyes widened. "Am I going to ride a horse? How is that etiquette training?" She shrugged in response. "Maybe it doesn't count as 'etiquette,' but I've never heard of a princess who can't ride a horse! Come now, let me help you up." You nervously approached the horse. "What's it's name?" you asked. "Graymare." Rochelle answered in a reassuring tone, "she's a good old horse; don't worry." You petted the grey horse with some hesitancy, but it only leaned in to your touch. After feeling relieved, you took Rochelle's hand and sat up on Graymare. As you gripped the reins you felt Rochelle's hands reach around your waist. "Now take it easy, milady, just calmly guide the mare with a whistle and a light tap." Perhaps it was this woman's body, perhaps it was the baby, but his actions seemed to be slipping out of control. He didn't like how he could feel happy one minute and rotten the next, and be completely powerless to do anything about it.

"I'm fine," Michael replied. He tried to shrug her away only to find a second handmaiden clutching his other arm.

The child growing in his womb was as much a product of the simulation as it was of Rex and himself - it was only natural that the simulation would want to protect it. He allowed the handmaidens to lead him into the castle, where they sat him beside the fire and brought him bowls of hot broth. 12.content:
Your name is Kal Luthor Kensington, an unfortunate consequence of having two comic book geeks for parents. You're twenty-six years old, a little doughy around the middle, with thin, receding hair. You work at The Escapist, a small comic-store-cum-cyber-cafe situated on the edge of the university campus in a trendy part of town.

The Escapist was established before you were born by your parents and though they technically still own it, they're rarely around these days - not mentally anyway - so you practically run the place yourself. The first floor is given over solely to comics, and had been your father's domain while he was still around - he was the biggest, most-insufferable nerd. Ground floor sells coffee and tea and cakes and is home to a collection of soft, chintzy sofas and chairs that your mother lovingly put together over the years. That woman had a taste - or a lack of it - all her own.

The basement is yours. Seven months ago, at your parent's behest, you'd taken charge of the cyber half of the cyber-cafe, renovating the basement by stripping out the ancient, obsolete computers and installing shiny new servers powerful enough to run virtual environments, along with two dozens bunks on which customers could recline while their minds sampled the simulated worlds.

It hadn't been cheap by any means, but it had proven popular, not least by your parents. They took full advantage of owning their own VR suite to enjoy a sort of early retirement, uploading their minds into the servers to exist in whatever simulations were running, living in the identities of the NPCs. It's been four months since you spoke to them last. Since their insertion they've gained an almost legendary reputation among the customers for their rare but memorable appearances. Usually they just live in the background, playing out their parts. Both had been avid roleplayers in their time and this suited them down to the ground.

You still see them in a sense. Their physical bodies have been fitted with simple Bodyguard personalities and still work in the shop where you can keep an eye on them, performing any tasks simple enough for the crude AI in their brains to comprehend. The amount of dumb crap they get up to on a daily basis never fails to brighten up your day. They keep the shop tidy and themselves physically active, cqretakers waiting for the day when their body's original owners return from simulation, should that day ever come at all. Judging by how comfortable your parents have become in their virtual existence, it is starting toolk unlikely that they'll ever return. Considering how much money you're raking it from their cafe, that might not be such a bad thing.

On this particular day, the business is doing well. The wet weather has driven customers off the streets into the VR suite where they can experience any weather they desire. Furthermore it's end-of-year exams and students have packed the place, dosing themselves up on large amounts of caffeine before diving into time-dilated edutainment sims to cram revision.

The bell above the door rings. It's a student, a stack of heavy textbooks held in her arms. Her auburn hair is all over the place and she looks manic, strung out, almost close-to-tears. She stands at the counter as you prepare some guy's cappuccino, and you watch her growing increasingly agitated as you carefully draw a triforce in the milk foam. As you cross the counter to give the guy his drink,, she grabs your arm. "I need more time! I have an exam in, like, two hours. Please, you have to give me more time!"

"Bunks are ten dollars an hour to rent," you reply. "If you want time-dilation, it's five dollars extra for each additional hour, so times two is fifteen, times three is twenty, and so on." Judging by the textbooks, the jittery nerves, and the way she throws wads of cash at you, you're thinking medical student. She buys one hour on a bunk at x200 dilation, which you generous round down to a nice $1000. Easiest money you ever made. If this keeps up, you might have to look into expanding the basement, perhaps buy some more sims. Your parents would love that.

You show her down into the VR suite. They call it the blue room for the flickering glow of the blue LEDs that adorn the computer banks that sit against one wall behind their protective glass. Other than their illumination, the room is kept dark. Almost all the bunks are occupied with limp bodies laid out on the soft foam mattresses, their faces obscured by visors, their mouths open and drooling. She climbs into one of the two empty bunks and you key in the details in the display beside it.

"One hour at x200. You'll want the library sim - it should have all the books you need. There's a few students in there already so at least you'll have company. If you need any help, there are terminals dotted around the sim that will send an alarm to me. Press any one of those and I'll come sort you out. Okay? See you in 8 days," you say. She secures the visor over her head and you engage the sim with a press of a button. Easiest '1k you ever made.

You take a minute just to check on the server vitals. Finding everything ticking over nicely, you head for the stairs that will take you back up to the cafe. As you do, the alarm begins to bleep. Somebody in one of the simulations is requesting assistance. It is...

You hear the buzzer but, glancing down the two rows of bunks, you can see no light. Then your eyes fall on the server. The amber light is flashing there. Your parents are in trouble.

It's been four months and there's not been a peep from them so far. When they inserted their minds, they'd given you specific instructions not to meddle in their new lives. As the administrator, you were essentially a god inside the simulations, capable of controlling every aspect of their existence, bestowing upon them infinite wealth, perfect bodies, anything they could possibly desire. As serious gamers and roleplayers, they'd made it clear they didn't want such preferential treatment. They wanted to live the lives the computer randomly selected for them, and any intervention or boon from their Godlike son would serve only to break their immersion.

"No matter how much I might beg you for a vorpal sword of +20 dragon slaying, you're not to give it to me," your dad had stated fiercely, as he'd fitted the neural-ripping headset around his bald cranium. "If we don't earn things within the limits of the game, then it doesn't mean anything." That had been the last thing he'd said to you before he'd become an empty shell and a data file.

If they're asking for your help, it must be serious.

You rush back upstairs, grabbing one of the more trustworthy nerds as he sits flicking through a comic. "Man the desk for me, Mike. I just need to check on the sims. If I'm not back in fifteen minutes, come in after me."

Grabbing the keys for the server room from beneath the desk, you dash back downstairs. A headset keyed with administrator privileges is plugged into one of them. You fasten it over your head and seat yourself on the floor with your back against the warm metal of the computer. Flicking the visor down, you're transported automatically and immediately to the source of the alarm within the simulation.

1213.content:
Administration is your favourite part of the job, and something you don't get to enjoy nearly enough. Jacking directly into the servers grants you admin status and privelages, manifesting as the ability to rewrite almost aspect of the sims while in them, ostensibly for the purpose of getting the users out of trouble or enhancing their experience. There is little you can't change or do - the maps can be remolded with a wave of your hand, avatars can be edited or swapped out entirely, AI characters can be deleted, added, or possessed. If you wish it, you can become invisible, fly with ease, or noclip, allowing you to walk through walls. The simulation can be sped up or slowed to a crawl. One of the most useful abilities is the Narrator Voice. The Narrator Voice, when activated, allows you give a command to any character, both AI or player, and they will be forced to obey it, whether they want to or not. Intended to move along stalled narratives or railroad players towards particular choices, it is particularly handy in the VR D&D sessions you GM every Friday night when dealing with the invariably unruly, rebellious party members.

In essence, the administrator is God within the simulation, and the computer works to incorporate this as seamlessly as possible, so as to maintain the suspension of disbelief for the players. Should the world have a mythology, it will strive to insert the admin as the Supreme Being and Creator or as a member of the pantheon of gods and goddesses. More mundane sims have more mundane admins. Military sims usually have you playing as a field marshal or admiral, historical sims as one of the powerful leaders of the age.

Your body goes limp as your mind enters VR, targeting in on the call of distress.

13.content:
Nate Wallace was tired. Once again he had just spent his day working at Imaginetech Industries developmental division where he'd spent at least 10 hours a day 5 days a week for 8 years with almost no time off. But finally all that time at work, all that time not having any social life to speak of had finally paid off. He'd been selected to be one of the select few to be selected to join the Imaginationland beta test. Imaginationland was a brand new form of virtual reality in which a person could actually put themselves into a randomly generated world with whatever theme the user chose. Unfortunately Nate's neck still hurt from the electronic port that had to be installed into his spine that allowed this to happen, but it was all going to be worth it. He would have the ultimate escape to go into after work where he could do literally anything. Nate quickly installed the necessary equipment into his computer and without even reading the instruction, Nate inserted the necessary wiring into his neck, felt a rush of electricity into his body, and passed out.

Now if he'd read the instructions he would know that there were problems with this beta. Most notably, not every scenario in the system had been tested and could potentially have unexpected results.

And also, since it was just the beta the user would not have any control over the avatar the chosen scenario would choose for them. That feature would be added in the future if all went well with the beta.
__________________________________________


Nate had no idea how long he had been out of it, it had felt no longer than the blink of an eye, but he awoke inside a virtual world. It hadn't been what he'd expected, outside of unending blackness was just a few floating series of menus. Nate tried to look down but realized that in this opening setting he didn't even have a body or any sort of avatar at all. After a few seconds (or maybe it was minutes or hours, Nate didn't have any grasp of time in this place) Nate set his focus to the menu's and found that he could scroll through them and search for a setting to insert him in. Nate searched and searched and found so many amazing and crazy choices. He felt like reading every one of them from University Life, Jungle, Underwater Experience, Inside a Harem, and it went on and on and on. Nate even found one that said 'Life of an Imaginetech' developer that he could use in case he wasn't sick and tired enough of his work.

Nate was overwhelmed, there was just so much he could put himself in! He was feeling even more stress now than he ever had at work. "I just want to relax! Is that too much to ask!" Nate complained allowed, but the Imaginationland menu seemed to be listening to him and presented 5 different choices for optimal relaxing. "That's more like it." Nate said as he examined the 5 easy going choices before him.

Initiate the Fun in Kindergarten scenario." With that the menu's disappeared and there was blackness as the simulation loaded. Alright, where is the avatar creation option?" Little did Nate know that there was no such an option for the beta of Imaginationland. It only took a moment for Nate to realize that the computer was automatically placing him in the body of a student without his express consent. And only a few more seconds to realize that the pigtails that were in his face were his. "Damn." Nate mumbled to himself, this wasn't exactly what he was hoping for. Before he could further assess the situation a little boy beside Nate raised his hand and blurted out, "Ooo ooo! Miss Moffet! Natty said a bad word!"

"Is what Bobby said true Natty?" The hot young teacher said locking eyes with Nate. Nate felt himself blush and was actually a bit intimidated by being confronted by someone much larger than him. "Well yeah, but..."

"No buts young lady. Now go to the time out corner, we'll talk about it after we finish learning out alphabet."

Nate couldn't believe it, this lady was now taking his little hand and was leading him to a stool in the corner so that he could think about what he did. Man, we sure did a great job with this program, I actually feel really crummy and embarrassed for this. Nate thought as he sat in the corner occasionally avoiding the eyes of fellow elementery school students when they would look back curiously. Nate decided to use this time to his advantage and took a look at himself, from what he could obviously tell, he was now a girl in kindergarten. Not only did the pigtails give it away, but so did the bright yellow shirt with flowers and a pony themed skirt. It took a few minutes but Nate went from annoyed at being placed in a girl's body to intellectually interested. This will give me a chance to really test out how real Imaginationland feels even as a completely different age and gender. Plus it'll be a fun story, the guys at work will get a kick out of this.

After Miss Moffet finished up teaching the alphabet she let the kids play on their own in the classroom. She then walked over to Nate and took a knee. "Now Natty, do you know why I put you in the corner? Do you know what you did wrong."

"Yes Miss Moffet. I'm sorry I said a bad word." Nate said politly deciding it best to play along.

Miss Moffet replied with a nice and comforting hug, "Good. I'm very proud of you. Now I'm not the only one you need to also apologize to Bobby."

"Yes Miss Moffet." Nate said as he hopped off the stool and walked over to the boy who ratted him out who was playing with some toy soldiers with some other boys.

"Hey, um, Bobby. I just wanted to say sorry. Mind if I play with you guys? I can be the navy guy." Nate said deciding to get into the scenario a bit more.

"No way! I don't want to get cooties!" Bobby said, and then out of nowhere he pushed Nate onto his back.

Nate was really taken aback, not only at how rude the boy was, but how helpless he was to stop him from pushing him to the ground. Miss Moffet apparently saw the whole thing and rushed over, "Bobby! You do not push anyone, especially a girl. Go to the timeout corner right this instant!"

Nate decided that enough was enough, "No Miss Moffet, I appreciate it but I'll take it from here. I'm gonna get out of here and delete this punk, or hell maybe I'll turn him into a little girl and see how he likes it." Nate said, "Computer, I think I'm ready to leave and get back to by body for now." Nate's confidence suddenly disappeared into nothingness as an error message popped up saying...
1311.title: Kindergarten Cutie

13111.content:
The user is too young to access interface. That was all the error message said. "What's going on?" Nate said aloud. As he stood there in his white high socks Bobby loudly said, "I don't like the way Natty is acting, you should send her to the timeout corner Miss Moffet!"

"Hush now Bobby, please go to the corner now before I have to ask again," as soon as Bobby left Miss Moffet said quietly to Nate, "Natty, is something wrong? You know you can talk to me."

"No. No problems. Nothing wrong whatsoever. I just need to go to the bathroom." Nate said and without even waiting permission, Nate darted off to the hallway. Nate's eyes widened, he'd expected to reemerge in the emptiness of the programing and become disembodied again, but he was still a 6 year old girl named Natty and this was an elementary school hallway. "No way." Nate said a little worried as he ran to the exit, he opened the door and once again Nate could only look dumbfounded. Outside of the school was a neighborhood, and Nate figured that around that neighborhood was a town, and outside of that town was a world. "The computer put me into a fully fledged world." Nate said feeling a bit overwhelmed before he composed himself, "Computer! Get me out of here now!"

The user is too young to access the interface. This message popped up once again. "Computer I am a 30 year old man, you interacted with me just minutes ago. You must recognize that."

The User is not Nate Wallace. The current User is 6 year old Natty Paige.

Now Nate was getting angry and desperate. "Listen, you are still a computer AI, artificial intelligence can not kill human's right? Well if you leave me here for 12 years like I take it you are suggesting, then my body and therefore I will die. Put this right." Nate said confidently feeling like this form of logic would work on the computer.

However instantly this message popped up, The User has been in this world for 10 simulated minutes, however in the User's physical world less than a millisecond has passed

"W-what?!" Nate said shocked, this was not good. Nate could be stuck here for at least 12 years perceived by him, growing up as a girl in this world, and his body would only age a few minutes, if that. "So I won't die, but I'll probably go insane, fantastic."

Now Nate began to weigh out his options, he could simply wait 12 in simulation years. He'd grow up, go to school all over again, only this time as a girl. Hell once he got out he could probably sue his company and write a bestselling novel with his experiences. But he was still putting his faith in the Imaginationland program that nothing else would go wrong. Or on the other hand he could try to hack the system from within to try and get out now. He could end up trapping himself forever or even getting himself deleted, but at least he had a shot of getting out now without the risk of slowly going insane while some simulation tried to teach him the alphabet all over again.

131112.content:
No. No way. Nate wanted to relax. But he was not going to be able to relax if he had to spend twelve years as a little girl. Okay, at least part of that he'd be a bigger girl, and then he'd get bigger, and get his period, and go to prom with a boy....

He shuddered involuntarily. He didn't even know why his thoughts went down that path, and he didn't want to find out. All he knew was that he had to figure out a way out of this simulation.

The way he saw it, he had two options. The first was to try the backdoor access to the hard code of the system. He remembered how to access it; a three-word code repeated three times would allow him access to the code that ran this simulation. The thing is, Nate wasn't a coder. He knew a bit of the programming language that ran this sim. Was it enough to age himself to 18? He didn't know, but he could try.

The other option was to stay young Miss Paige, but to play it as a girl who suddenly knew as much as a 30-year-old adult. By changing the way his character is perceived, maybe he could change his legal status within the simulation. Of course, that was a long shot, but if he stuck with being a 6-year-old, he'd have time to refine it as he went along.

Nate sighed. If he was going to access the code, he'd better get on with it; otherwise, he should probably go back to class and start amazing his teacher.

On top of that add in the whole helpless baby, possibly without anyone around to help. Nate realized after a few days that it was going to be a long time before he'd even get a chance to even attempt a reprogramming. Even though he knew in his head how the human body was able to move and speak down to the names of the ligaments, he found that the program itself prevented him from doing anything physically that a normal baby could. As soon as Nate realized this he found himself getting depressed and zoned out of his everyday life as the days just went by. Every day consisted of being fed, sleeping, and 'mandated recreational activities' which usually entailed the Mother program placing him on the ground amid age appropriate toys.

But this was the one time Nate was thankful for his crappy real life. His many years of corporate boring monotony had trained him well for this. Being forced to eat mushed peas and roll balls around? Absolutely heavenly compared to many years of staring at blank computer screens and filling out piles of useless paperwork. As crummy as the daily life of a baby girl was, Nate found himself breezing through life with practical ease. He was able to run around the house Mother had created for them without stumbling once. A little moment like this felt like a gargantuan victory that motivated Nate to just keep chugging along until he could speak and reprogram. Little by little Nate found little victories. A few weeks later he could burp on his own without having to be picked up and patted on the back, a few weeks later he was able to operate his own spoon so he could feed himself when the mushed veggies were put before him.

"No longer baby Natty...huh?!" Nate was shocked as a cute little girl voice came out of his mouth as opposed to his usual seemingly random noises. "Finally! Computer! Active emergency override program Code Red!"

2.) TIME IS RELATIVE. THOUGH TIME WILL APPEAR TO MOVE JUST A SLOWLY AS IT DOES IN THE WORLD WORLD, IT WILL BE MOVING AS THE SPEED OF THE SLOWEST PROCESSOR. FOR EACH VIRTUAL WEEK THAT PASSES, ONLY A DAY WILL PASS OUTSIDE THE SYSTEM. A YEAR IN PLAY, IS ONLY 52 DAYS. SPECIAL CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN TO PLAN AHEAD TO CARE FOR THEIR PHYSICAL BODIES IN LENGTHY PLAY. IF THE BODY DIES WHILE IN PLAY, CONSCIOUSNESS WILL REMAIN IN SYSTEM PERMANENTLY.
