Nate can't hold it in - snaps at the kids and storms out
1313.content:
The air around Nate's current non-body blurred and a force propelled him towards the classroom. Unable to control his movement or which direction he zoomed in, Nate had no choice but to close his eyes and pray an anti-virus program in the system would eject him from what was clearly a malfunctioning Imaginationland unit, not noticing as he did so that he was heading straight for the young teacher as she guided the class through their ABC's.

He entered through the back of her head. A series of clicks and whirrs indicated that the insertion was complete, and then he could only hear the classroom buzz of children kicking, muttering and scrawling on their desks with half-chewed pencils.

Wind blew up Nate's skirt... Skirt? He lowered his hand to check the sensation when he noticed the piece of chalk he was holding. His hand, he saw, was much slimmer than he remembered, with a wooden bracelet around his wrist and lime-green painted nails. His breathing accelerated and with it the rate at which he noticed the width of his enormous bosom, hidden from innocent children's eyes by a professional white blouse tucked into his skirt, belted in such a way that it billowed and obscured his figure. He felt it all, though, including the very frilly, very sensually-cut bra that spoke more of velvet sheets than glue stuffed up six-year olds' noses. Dirty-blonde hair tickled his forehead, cupped his ears and made it impossible to feel air on the back of his neck. Some of it fell on his eyes, so when he turned to face the children he barely made them out through the strands.

"It's Z!" a puny girl with horn-rimmed glasses chirped. "You didn't say the last letter, Miss Moffett. It's Z!"

"Oh..." was all Nate could say. Voice so soothing with one syllable... Oh. Oh shit. He hadn't expected this. And so real too. How could you be the opposite gender in a computer program and- And feel all that? And, it dawned on him now, how could you be a teacher and not teach a class you had apparently just been teaching!? The students continued to stare. Relaxing, his ass, Nate just went from relatively comfortable cubicle life to babysitter for twenty little hell-spawns!

What does he do?
1313.title: Hot as Teacher

choices: "Well I guess that's not who you wanted to be, huh?"
13132.content:
Nate felt a convincing simulation of sweat emerging on his face as he endured the expectant stares of the many children. This was like the presentation he'd been roped into giving a few weeks ago, except he hadn't even been given lines to forget. He nervously glanced around the room and marvelled at how detailed it all was. Every notice and picture on the wall was unique and believable. On the desk in front of him was a stack of writing exercises, each one exhibiting a different variety of sloppy handwriting. Nate hurriedly searched the desk for some clue as to what he was meant to be doing.

"Miss Moffet...?" one of the kids spoke up, having waited long enough for the teacher to say something.

"Can we do painting now?" another child said.

"When's lunch?" asked a third.

Nate approached panic, seeing he was running out of time to figure this out. But then he belatedly realised: this was just a simulation. These weren't real kids, so why bother looking after them? Having thus freed himself from concern, he turned his thoughts back to annoyance at the program for messing up his request.

"I don't want to do this!" he snapped, finding it difficult to properly express his anger in the soft voice he'd been given. "I'm out of here!"

Ignoring the cacophony of confused reactions, Nate guided the teacher's shapely body to the door. He half expected to open it and step out into a white void or some such incongruous thing, but the outside of the classroom was just as realistic as the inside. So far the simulation had proven indistinguishable from reality, a slightly worrying thought.

Having no idea where he was going or why, Nate wandered down the corridor until he came across what seemed to be a back entrance. As he approached it, he turned to look back and saw that none of the children seemed to have followed him... a belief that lived only until a small girl emerged from behind a corner.

"Miss Moffet?" she began, looking strangely at Nate before continuing...
13132.title: Teacher's strike

131322.content:
"Well I guess that's not who you wanted to be, huh?"

"What?" Nate gasped, taken aback. The girl snickered.

"Didn't think you'd run into another player?" she said. "Can't blame you. There are a lot of scenarios and not a lot of us. But somehow it happens. Of course, it was obvious to me when you took control of that body. Too obvious, really. We should work on that."

After taking a moment to process the idea that the small child in front of him was actually one of his colleagues, Nate took the opportunity to express his frustration. "Well, I wasn't supposed to!" he fumed. "I wanted to be one of the kids!"

The girl shrugged nonchalantly. "Yeah, automatic placement is a crapshoot right now. It's a beta, you can't expect it to go smoothly. Especially when it's this complicated."

Nate blinked. He would have expected someone half his size to have more of a reaction to his outburst. Hearing what appeared to be a child talking to him like an adult was almost as surreal as being in a woman's body.

"Anyway," the girl continued, "You've got a job to do now. Let's get back to class, shall we?"

"I don't think so! This isn't what I signed up for!" Nate complained.

"Hey, what you signed up for is to beta test this thing," the girl said, "And one of the most important things to test is whether the system can maintain realistic behaviour over time. That means we should act normally and see if things go the way we would expect." She turned to the side, brushing her long hair out of her face, before hesitantly adding, "Besides... I was having fun until you showed up."

Nate grunted in annoyance, a sound that reminded him of his mother. He had at least one question to ask before he would even consider playing along. "Who are you, anyway?"

The girl looked up at him slyly. "Hmm... you go first."

"I'm Nate Wallace," Nate grumbled. The girl's eyes widened in response, and she froze in place for a second before bursting into laughter.

"Hey! What's so funny?" Nate demanded.

"Hahaha... ah..." Attempting to compose herself, the girl stifled a few more giggles before responding...

1313221.content:
"Come on. Don't kid me," the girl said. The disbelieving expression on her face was light-years beyond her age. "This system's buggy but not THAT buggy, right? Come on!"

"What's there to kid about?" Nate said, upset. "I am Nate Wallace. That's all there is to it."

"So you're a guy?" The girl leveled Nate a hard stare.

He shrugged. "Yeah. Though I don't..." He gestured toward his face. "...look it. Yeah."

Now the amusement had disappeared. The girl fiddled with her cotton Angry Birds skirt as she clearly fought with herself to say something, and seeing this, Nate knew that it could only be more bad news. He dreaded but needed to hear it.

"All right," he said, his tone becoming strict and maternal. "Out with it. Why can't I be a guy and have a woman's body?"

"Because Imaginetech released a schedule for when certain employees could beta test Imaginationland? And today was very clearly 'Female Employees Only', as specified on every sign-up form and poster and announcement for the event? Were you paying any attention all of this week?"

All at once, the memories back-handed Nate across the brain. He had been so tired for the past month that the announcement that he'd be a beta tester registered as only a slight blur. There was something about the female beta-testers and male beta-testers needing to work on separate days... Something about the random body selection being specified according to... your own gender... Shit...

He told the girl as much and she sighed.

"So if you bump into any other employees in this scenario, they will all be female," she said. "And you will be the one male commandeering a female body."

"But that's not so terrible!" Nate insisted. "Just because I'm a woman now doesn't mean that will interfere with the other players, right? One teacher is the same as any other teacher. I can still play my role even though I have breasts."

The girl shook her head. "If only it were that simple. See..."

"Talk too long with any AI characters and they will realize you're not female."

"And that's bad?" Nate replied.

"Very bad," the little girl nodded, her tone severe and her childish face serious. "The AI is able to cope with divergent player behaviour only up to a point. It can deal with male characters who act like men, and female characters that act like women, but if you start behaving in ways it can't predict then the simulation doesn't like it. It'll start to retaliate, forcing you into conforming to your character's anticipated behaviours."

Nate gulped. "They become violent?"

"And worse," the girl said darkly, twisting the fabric of her skirt and casting furtive glances about the corridor. "It was the only way we could keep the players acting in limits that maintained the believability of the world. In the early beta, we always got players in infantile bodies going on shooting and vehicular manslaughter sprees. The computer didn't know how to respond to it. So we programmed in the Nanny Subroutine. It clamps down on deviant behaviour; if it can't control it, it automatically removes it from the simulation."

"And I've triggered it-"

"-as soon as you stepped outside the classroom," she nodded. "Now it'll stop at nothing to get you back on track."

Nate tensed at the sound of tiny feet approaching. Around the corner appeared one of his pupils, a young boy clutching a tattered, worn blanket tightly. His lip trembled pitifully and he sniffed back the tears brimming in his large, sad eyes. "Miss Moffett?" he asked in a tiny, timid voice. "Are you okay? Are you coming back to the classroom? I really, really wanted to know what comes after Y, Miss Moffett." He reached out and opened his hand, revealing a few coins in the palm of his hand. "I've been saving up my dinner money to buy my sister a birthday present, Miss Moffett, but I'll give you it if you come back to the classroom."

Nate was aghast. "That is evil..."

"Isn't it?" the other player whispered with a mixture of pride and disgust. "I programmed those puppy-dog eyes myself. Emotional manipulation is just the start of it. So... fancy coming back and teaching me my alphabet?"
13132212.title: The foreign nature of the player

Something else dire pops up during the school day
131322121.content:
"Do I have a choice?" Nate murmured. He looked between the two children who were gawking at him expectantly, one with the most horrible guilt-tripping eyes conceived, and decided that being a kindergarten teacher was not the worst fate possible. Besides, the obligation ended when the school day ended, and then he could figure out how to escape the simulation, or at least transfer his mind into another virtual body.

He started walking at a clipped pace back down the hallway. "Fine. I will teach you the last... letter of the alphabet."

The other player said nothing but merely gave a goofy whoop as she followed. By the time Nate remembered he had never gotten her name, they were already re-entering the classroom.

Applause and droning yays filled the room when Nate stepped back in. My God. They really want me to feel good about playing this part, Nate thought. He made it to the chalkboard after a minute of children rushing his legs, hugging them and expressing their undying love for Miss Moffett. He convinced them to return to their seats, amazed at how their touch lingered on his fishnets with startling accuracy. Silence fell on the crowd. He saw the player sitting in the second row near the wall, hand cradling her chin as her shoulders lolled, a convincing impression of a bored, giddy kindergartener.

If she can play the part...

Nate shook away the remnants of his discomfort and, seizing a piece of chalk, wrote on the board "Z." He turned back with what he hoped was a kindly smile. "The last letter of the alphabet," he cooed. "Repeat after me. Z."

The room roared out of sync, "Z!" and because it seemed like the right thing to do, Nate went on, "Let's say the entire alphabet now, very slowly and in order. Everybody follow me: A - B - C..."

All anxieties that had been swimming inside his head were momentarily drowned out by the booming of hyper-energetic children with no sense of voice volume. Maybe being a kindergarten teacher really was a vacation, at least compared to his old life outside the program...

"I just want to be left alone..." Nate groaned. He reached down behind his desk and by luck found Miss Moffett's purse within seconds. Rummaging inside, her car keys, wallet and other essentials came with a little more effort, after sifting through cosmetics, pepper spray, and loose change and credit cards that showed Miss Moffett as at least comfortable in her financial position, if not very lucky indeed given her profession.

She insisted: "Come on! It couldn't have been that bad a first day."

"Oh yeah. It was fun to keep children from stuffing crayons up their nose while they were trying to draw the alphabet on a piece of colored paper, most of which their drawings don't even show up on, or are unintelligible. Sleeping time would have been nice, but you guys did that already. Reading time too..."

"Then you have tomorrow to look forward to!" the player said with a bounce in her step. "It'll be even better. Tomorrow, we're starting numbers-"

"Look..." Nate tried to address her while reading Moffett's driver's license. She lived in Apartment 4 on 256 Missouri Road... Mabel Town... "Don't you have, like, a bus to catch, parents to pick you up?" 1313221211.title: School's Out

13132212111.content:
"I'm supposed to be your daughter."

"What?!" Nate yelped. "Why didn't you mention that before?"

The player shrugged unapologetically. "I figured I'd let you deal with one thing at a time."

"Great," Nate sighed, wearily leaning on the desk. "So what, I'm a single mom now?"

"I guess," the player said, shrugging again. "I mean, I dunno, you could have a boyfriend or something."

"Gah. I hope not," Nate grimaced. He finally picked up the purse and hoisted it onto his shoulder. "What am I supposed to call you, anyway?"

"Chrissy," the player answered. "I did write it on my paper, you know. Exclamation mark and all."

"Right... Do I get to know your real name?"

'Chrissy' gave a sly grin. "Oh, I don't know, I think I like being mysterious. Maybe if you keep doing a good job, I'll tell you."

"Whatever," Nate grumbled as he opened the door. "How long do we have to keep this up for, anyway?" he asked, figuring his 'daughter' wasn't about to let him quit when he felt like it.

"At least another day or so," she replied. "Preferably more. We're supposed to go through all of the characters' routines." She walked out the classroom door and looked around to check there was no-one in the corridor. "That's a day in simulation time, of course. We haven't actually been hooked up for as long as we've perceived."

"I know that," Nate growled. Imaginetech's marketers and higher-ups often touted that one could enjoy days of virtual vacationing before there would be any need to return to reality.

"So you're not completely clueless?" Chrissy teased. As they began walking to the buildings front door, she spoke more quietly, "Now remember, as long as anyone else is around, I'm your five-year-old daughter. Oh, and do try your best to act like a woman. I don't really want to see what we'll be faced with if you're not convincing on that front."

As Nate exited the building, his virtual breath was taken away by the vivid impression of the outdoor world before him. The sun shone, the birds sang, the wind blew and a thin but endless stream of cars and people flowed through the streets. Chrissy giggled happily at Nate's awestruck expression.

Once he'd shook off his amazement, Nate nervously glanced between the three cars in the school's parking lot until he noticed that one had a booster seat in the back. "I guess this is my car?" he asked, approaching it.

Sure enough, the car key from his purse opened it. After a second's thought, Nate opened the back door as well. He started climbing into the driver's seat when Chrissy's voice interrupted him. "Help me up."

Nate turned back to her, confused. "What?"

"Help me up," she repeated, standing on tiptoes and gesturing to the booster seat.

Nate studied the car's back seats for a second before concluding, "You could get up there yourself."

"Yes, but I'm not supposed to," Chrissy hissed.

"Er, right, yes... dear," Nate stammered, noticing a man in a suit passing by. Chrissy smiled as Nate lifted her into the booster seat and fastened her seatbelt.

Once in the driver's seat, Nate searched for clues as to where he was going, and found a map in the glove compartment. "Oh, good." He placed the map on the dashboard before starting the car and guiding it out of the parking lot. He drove slowly through the unfamiliar streets, frequently referencing the map and wondering if this town was based on a real place, or if the system had somehow made it all up.

"Hey, do you think you could hurry up?" Chrissy said, leaning sideways to see around Nate's seat. "I don't think struggling to find your own home is expected behaviour."

"I'm trying!" Nate barked back. "Here it is, Missouri Road..." he said, taking a left turn.

"Say, you don't feel like your driving is any worse than normal, do you?" Chrissy asked as the car pulled into the conveniently available parking spot in front of the apartment building.

"What do you..." Nate twigged to her meaning halfway through his sentence. "Shut up," he spoke over her giggles.

Nate got out of the car and opened the back door for Chrissy. He hoped she would at least exit the car by herself, but she just looked at with an expectant smile until he sighed and lifted her out.
