The hand revealing the reason for her treatment. It was a terrifying accusation, as a tiny baggie of liquid drugs was held in front of her eyes as justification, and accusation.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/d7/bd/b7/...

"Well, Cindi?" The woman snarled, "Anything you can say in your defence?"

She ripped away the tape with a sharp tug, "As if there was anything you could say!" She almost shouted the final words.
14533.title: As a buxom blonde woman somewhere entirely unex...

choices: Set something up, but wait for William to come home.
151.content:
You are 26-year-old Debora Hall. You were Debora Jenkins until about ten months ago, when you married your love William, a wonderful event preceded by a wonderful courtship and followed by an equally wonderful honeymoon.

And now that that's all done with, you're quite bored. Today is another day of sitting around the house while William is away at work. You don't want a job of your own because you're preparing to a full-time mother. Problem is, William seems scared by the prospect of having kids, even though you'll be the one devoting yourself to their care.

The good news is that William has been rocketing up the corporate ladder and bringing in loads of money, so when you do have children, they'll be well provided for. Unless, of course, he continues to blow increasing amounts of cash on things to distract you from needling him about starting a family. His latest and most extravagant such purchase is the virtual reality helmet which is now in your hands and hooked up to your computer via an assortment of wires and little boxes that seems more complicated than it really needs to be. A second helmet lies on the desk, so William can join you when he gets home.

It's a sophisticated (if not sophisticated-looking) piece of work, but apparently the real reason this stuff is so expensive is because if they allowed just anyone to create their own simulation, they'd... use up all their gigabytes or something. You don't really understand technology very well, but you think you can get this thing working. You've started up the program, and now the screen is telling you to put on your "virtual interface headset", which you assume means the helmet.

So you make yourself comfortable in the chair and carefully place the helmet on your head. Everything goes black for a frightening second, and then your vision is filled by a menu consisting of the options "Create Simulation", "Enter Simulation" and "Disengage". You try to lift your arm, but find that you can't. You can't even feel it, in fact. You would gasp in response to this, but you can't do that either. You frantically wonder how you're supposed to select anything, but then the "Create Simulation" option flashes by itself. Apparently the system just knows what you want it to do. You're not sure if that's amazing, or amazingly scary.

The next screen, if you can call it that, doesn't seem to have any actual options on it. It begins with just the words "Think of something." in large letters. Can you really create any virtual world imaginable just by thinking of it? As your mind races with possibilities, lines of text fly in and out of your vision too fast to read. You're apparently supposed to focus on something and read what the computer has to say about it. So what will you think of?
151.title: A bored housewife

choices: Explore a world of elves, orcs, dragons, and whatever else.
Roam the world in search of ancient relics and lost history.
Discover that final frontier among the stars.
1512.content: You want something exciting, something outside your normal life if only to escape the boredom for a little bit. At first you think about something in a fantasy world; what could be further from your life than swinging swords, slinging spells, and skulking through the shadows? It would be like some of those fantasy books you’ve got laying about. You also think about those Indiana Jones movies you’ve seen recently, maybe you could be an adventurer heading out to find ancient items in the far corners o the world. Still keeping those two options in mind, you also wonder about maybe going futuristic, exploring the stars and seeing what you can find throughout the galaxy. So which is it going to be, you can always keep the other two options – and many more besides – in mind and make use of them later on, you might need to escape the real world again at some other time after all.
1512.title: Three flavors of alternate lives

choices: You are greeted by an Amazonian version of yourself.
You instead see yourself in a buxom bovine body.
You are in a completely different body.
15121.content:
You focus on creating a fantasy world with magic and warriors, royalty and commoners, and tombs and caverns loaded with loot for those brave enough to face whatever horrors may lie in wait within. The blackness surrounding you unfolds like origami, revealing a crisp blue sky dotted with puffy clouds that look so real and close that it looks like you could reach out and touch them, and even accompanied by a cool breeze that sends a shiver around your body. Off in the distance, you see a speck come out from behind one of the clouds; at first you think that it’s a bird maybe, but that thought doesn’t last long as it continues to get bigger and bigger finally revealing that it’s a massive dragon as it goes roaring past you. With a jolt, you realize that you still can’t move your arms or even most of the rest of your body, but at least you can look around. Your shock is compounded when you realize that you are high up – very high up – so high that the ground is just a mosaic of colors laid out beneath you. At first you think you might be standing on the edge of a mountain till you see that you are actually floating in the air, far above the ground.

You start to wonder what you are supposed to do, when you suddenly get the sensation of falling; the clouds appear to rise higher in the sky as you drop to the ground, and wind whistles in your ears as you continue to plummet. A scream catches in your throat as the ground races ever faster to meet you. Screwing your eyes shut, but prevented from doing anything else because of your inability to move your body, you think that this is quite fun: you just turned the bloody thing on and you are already going to go splat. But…it doesn’t happen, instead of the onrushing impact, you instead feel an electric tingle shoot around your body before a much softer landing slightly jostles you. Cracking your eyes open reveals that you are now on the ground with nothing the worse for wear despite your apparently meteoric drop to the ground. All around you, you see a bustling marketplace in what appears to be a medieval city, filled with all manner of people: humans, orcs, elves, gnomes, and even a smattering of things you think are called anthros. You also find that you can move your body again, but are a bit shocked at what you find when you spy your reflection in a nearby mirror.
15121.title: Living in a fantasy

choices: “Where’s the nearest place a girl can get a drink?”
“There a shop for me to get some adventuring gear at?”
“Do you know a place where I can get a quest or something?”
151212.content:
You stumble towards the mirror, unused to the dimensions of your body in this world, though this adds an additional bounce that only further emphasizes the ridiculousness of your new curves. Huge breasts that are larger than your head strain the simple shirt wrapped around your upper body, while the pants below look almost painted on around your large fertile looking hips and rump. Your first thought is an exaggerated hourglass shape, but as you look closer, you see that your belly adds a little extra space to the middle of that hourglass; it’s not fat by any means, just a little extra softness almost entirely hidden in the shadow of your bust above. Tearing your eyes away from your curves, you turn your attention to other portions of your body, like the thick and silky black and white fur that covers your whole body, and the long and whip-like tail that swishes around behind you. On the very tip of your tail is a little tuft of blood red hair/fur that matches the thick waves of hair that spills from your head and down around your shoulders. And thinking of your hair, it hasn’t changed much in the switch, only lengthened slightly and split somewhat around the additions of a pair of horns and longer and floppier ears sprouting from your head.

You continue to visually explore your body – and eventually start running your long dexterous fingers around as well – thinking that you could get used to this body. It certainly isn’t something you would choose to have in the real world, these mammoth breasts alone would make it a challenge to move let alone stand as you are, but you are actually starting to enjoy the thought of having this body in your little fantasy world here.

“Can I help you with anything, ma’am,” a throaty voice croaks out, making you jump out of your thoughts.

Looking up you see a thickset wolf staring at you from behind the stand the mirror is propped again. With a jolt, you realize that he is most likely the owner of this stand, and he has been standing there for most if not all of the time that you have been inspecting your body. And judging from the way his eyes keep darting down to look at your body and the way he keeps licking his lips, you are reasonably sure that he enjoyed the impromptu show even more than you did.

Putting on one of your most coy smiles, you say, “No thanks, I’m good.” You can see his face falls as you turn around, thinking about what next to do, but then turn around and say, “Maybe there is something you can help me with.”

He looks so hopeful again, as you lean on his stand, coiling a strand of hair around one of your fingers.
151212.title: A new cow-girl

choices: It stops on the warrior image.
The rogue picture is the one showing.
You’re supposed to be a mage, it seems.
1512122.content:
“There a shop for me to get some adventuring gear at?” you ask with a flirtatious smile.

The wolf seems torn, licking in his lips as casually as he can; on one hand, helping you means you will most likely end up going away, but he might still get a reward of some sort out of the deal, on the other hand, if he can draw things out, who knows what might happen. To help encourage him to assist you, you thrust your chest out, seeing that is where his eyes are lingering most of the time. You are unused to your new dimensions though, so that small motion gets overblown and ends up with your meaty breasts knocking over a number of things on the top of his stand.

You wince and blush as you hear the sounds of things falling into each other; your blush only deepens when you hear and feel the topmost button on your shirt go shooting off somewhere, exposing yet more of the furry canyon between your luscious mounds. Judging from the saucer-like appearance of the shopkeeper’s eyes as well as his slack jaw, he has noticed – and really how couldn’t he – and likes what he is seeing. Clearing your throat loudly causes him to regretfully tear his eyes away and look up at your face; he then starts to rattle off a detailed set of directions leading you through the marketplace and to a store where you can get what you want. After telling him thanks, you turn on your heel with a flirty giggle and walk away, making sure to add plenty of extra sway to your hips and derrière as a bit of thanks.

You quickly make your way through the milling crowd of the marketplace, helped in no small part by your stature. You only now realize that you stand nearly head if not head and shoulders above everyone else, though there are some people that are as about tall as you and a rare number that look to be even taller. You practically shiver at this though, the prospect that you can literally look down on most other people being particularly thrilling to you.

Following the directions laid out by the wolf, you soon find yourself heading out of the main marketplace and into a somewhat less traveled area of the city. There are still plenty of people about, but not the heavy mass from the main square and most of them seem to be more what you consider adventurers would look like. You are still attracting plenty of attention, eyes going wide as they see you come bouncing down the narrow streets.

You lose track of your path sometimes, the narrow winding roads making it easy to get lost, but it never takes long before you find your way again. And so it is that before you realize it, you are nearly walking past your destination. The building could do with some sprucing up and definitely needs a new paint job, while the sign above the door is worn and weather beaten, but you can make out the peeling paint that reads “Iron Tusk Craftsmen”. The door creaks open at your touch revealing a large room overflowing with stacks upon stacks of what you can only think of as adventuring gear: leather armor on mannequins lean against racks of gleaming swords, while some of the suits of plate armor have wizard staffs shoved into the neck openings, there’s even bows hanging from some of the torches on the walls. As you pick your way through the piles – only knocking a few things over, and not causing too many domino effects – you hear more clattering coming from the back of the room, like someone else moving around in this hodgepodge mess.

Following the noises as best as you can, you take a looping path that eventually leads you to a counter in the back of the room, similarly covered like the rest of the space. You can almost make out someone bent over behind the counter, bent over and up to his or her waist in a crate digging around and making quite a bit of noise. It takes several increasingly loud times of clearing your throat before they seem to hear you. They bang their head in their haste, and you assume swear in a language you don’t recognize, before turning around to face you rubbing their head.

The tall slender man – now that you can see him clearly – is momentarily taken aback at seeing you, but he recovers quickly; “Greetings, my lady, and welcome to the Iron Tusk Craftsmen. How may we assist you today?”

“I was looking for adventuring gear or something like that,” casting a glance over your shoulder, “And it looks like I’ve come to the right place.”

“You are correct; we have many pieces of equipment for everyone from beginners through the experts. May I ask if you have a particular preference for a style?” Noting the quizzical expression on your face, he continues, “Such as heavy platemail with a great sword, or lighter armors with a dagger or bow, that is what I mean.”

“Oh, I…eh…I’m not sure,” you admit, this all seemed much simpler in your head.

“That isn’t a problem, ma’am” ducking down behind the counter again, “We have something here for just such a circumstance. Ah, here it is.” Standing up with a large crystal set in a stand, “This is a little something put together by our own Madame Morrigan; just put your hand against the crystal and it will recommend a style. You can, of course, choose something else either now or later, and even mix and match styles if you so wish.”

Shrugging, you do as directed, finding the crystal oddly warm beneath your hand. After a moment of nothing happening, you are about to speak up, when the stone starts glowing brightly and projecting a sphere just above it. Within the sphere, you can just make out images flashing through rapidly, though as you watch, the speed slows down so that eventually you are able to make out little pictures of swords, bows, and staves, each with a matching outfit just behind, heavy armor, lighter armor, or a robe respectively. The flipping keeps getting slower and slower, but not quite stopping yet, but you can tell it's getting there.
1512122.title: Using your assets

choices: You start out badly, but learn quickly, getting better in a short time.
You have an almost superhuman ability with the bow.
You miss shot after shot, never once getting close to the target.
15121222.content:
You stare down at the little image of a bow with light armor standing behind it, not quite sure how you feel about it. The more you think about it though, the more that seems like a good idea: being able to pick off targets from a distance without having to get your hands dirty, and being able to keep fully mobile without being too weighted down. You look up at the tall man behind the counter and nod, agreeing with the assessment of the odd little crystal.

He nods in return, but just a slight tilt of the head, “You will want to see Master Orinan, in that case, just through here please.”

He shuffles out from behind the counter, edging past the precarious stacks and leads you through one of the side doors. The room beyond is obviously a workshop, and much more structured than the main showroom, with a great deal more empty floor space, and well organized workbenches. An even taller and more slender man is standing at one of the tables, carefully shaving off hair-thin flakes of wood from an obviously masterly crafted bow. The man from the counter starts to open his mouth, but – presumably – Master Orinan holds up a finger without looking back, and the one you were following shuts his mouth so quickly that you can hear his teeth click. The Master continues working with the soft scraping of his tool as the only noise, but you are starting to get a little irritated.

Just as you are about to say something yourself, no matter if this “master” holds his finger up towards you, he gives one last look down the length of the bow before starting to speak himself.

“What is it, Sebastian?” and as he finishes, he turns around and sees you, which seems to answer his question.

His eyes briefly open wide, before returning to their previous half-lidded state; you wonder if you really look so out of the ordinary that everyone has to be so obviously surprised at seeing you. You can now see that Master Orinan is an elf, the long pointed ears sweeping back into his hair is kind of a giveaway.

“So, you wish to take some of my equipment, is that it?” Orinan says, moving closer, almost seeming to float across the ground.

You nod, and Sebastian chimes in, “She used the crystal, Master, and it…”

He gets cut off as Orinan holds up his hand in his direction, while continuing to look you over, “That will be all, Sebastian, you may return to your other duties.”

The way that Orinan is looking you over makes you feel somewhat uncomfortable, there’s an unmistakable aura of haughtiness about him, but there’s also something almost predatory as well, almost as if he is trying to figure out the best spot to grab a hold of you or to sink his teeth. You barely notice that Sebastian bows so low that his face is almost completely hidden as the thick curls of hair cascade forwards, but you do see that when he stands upright again, he brushes his hair back, momentarily revealing somewhat pointed ears, but shorter than those sported by Orinan; another kind of elf maybe, or perhaps a half elf you assume, based on some of the stories you have read. Sebastian then lopes off, leaving you alone under the gaze of the haughty master.

“So you’re an aspiring fortune-hunter, and came to me after using Morrigan’s crystal?” to which you nod in response. “And you don’t know for sure what you want?” he asks and gets a repeated response. “In that case, may I suggest that unless you have a rather large surplus of funds, that you begin with the basic package; it will grant you a basic suit of armor, a bow and standard quiver of arrows, and a short sword for close in work.”

With a grimace, you now realize that you don’t have any funds at all, you were dropped into the world with only the clothes on your back.

Seemingly picking up on this, he then says “If you don’t have any money at all, that won’t be an issue. You can take the equipment and in return do a couple simple jobs for me. It’s not the first time that an adventurer to be has come to our little shop to get started completely penniless, and done quite well for themselves from then on.”

It’s not ideal, but it’s certainly different from my normal life, and that’s what I wanted after all you think. You agree to his terms, wondering what kind of “jobs” he’ll send you on.

“There is one other matter, I don’t have any armor already made for one with your…build,” even without looking him in the eye, you can practically feel his gaze tracing along your bust and hips, “but I have a set close to finish that I should be able to adapt easily enough. In the meantime, why don’t you take the training bow over there and proceed out through there, you can practice with it in the training yard beyond the shop. Do be careful now.”

You open your mouth to ask if he needs to take your measurements or anything, but realize that if he isn’t already asking for that, he must already have it in hand somehow. Grabbing the indicated bow and a bundle of arrows hanging with them, you head through a rear door and into a fenced in yard behind the shop. A couple of people are practicing with swords in one corner, but you have a long clear shot to an obvious archery target: a straw dummy in the rough shape of a person. You remember a bit of the archery work you did in gym back in school, but even this training bow is quite different than the one you used then. Slinging the quiver on your back, you nock and arrow, sight down the length, and let fly.
15121222.title: Going rogue

choices: There’s a group of bandits that have caused some trouble.
Something easier than that and it’s a classic: someone has a rat problem.
You’ve got a more challenging task: helping to escort a caravan.
151212221.content:
Your first shot is terrible, you’re actually afraid that it will fly over the fence and hit someone on the other side. You forgot to adjust for your new body, your curves getting in the way of the bow. Your second shot is no better, nearly catching the bowstring on your breasts both coming and going, and just barely missing catching a button on your shirt and tearing it free too. You hear some laughs from across the yard – apparently the swordsmen are enjoying the impromptu show – but you ignore it, focusing on improving your accuracy. The third, forth, and fifth arrows are much closer, missing the target just to one side or the other. That one week every year you spent with a bow and arrow in school isn’t much of a help now, but it is a starting point at least.

When you finish shooting the last arrow from the quiver on your back, you look over the target and see the hits that you have made, along with all of the misses. Marching over, you gather the arrows up and return to where you started, and begin again. This time you make quite a few more hits, even scoring a few direct shots to the roundels painted on the dummy. As you continue to draw and fire, you start to realize that you’re progressing far faster than you should be able to; your accuracy is going up, and that’s somewhat expected with the practice, but your speed and even strength are also obviously increasing, you’re able to fire much faster than before as well as pulling the bowstring back much more easily than when you started. You’re nowhere near approaching superhuman levels or anything like that, but it’s almost as if every shot is getting you more practice than you might expect. It’s actually kind of nice, being able to pick up something new without as much effort as might normally be required. Maybe it’s to do with this virtual world you suppose, before I wonder if this applies to other things in this world too?

The swordsmen aren’t laughing any longer, and they don’t seem to be practicing now either, judging from the lack of sounds coming from their way. You don’t look over at them though, still concentrating on firing arrow after arrow into the target. On the third round, you are only having a few misses, with most getting close to the targets. You’re still not pulling off trick shots like firing multiple arrows at the same time or splitting arrows from nock to tip with each following arrow, but it still feels good to be able to get so many shots on target from where you were just a short time ago.

The sun steadily moves across the sky, but you focus solely on the back and forth repetition. You just finish gathering the arrows again after the umpteenth time when you hear someone clapping. Looking around, you first look over at the pair that was practicing with swords, but they both shake their head and point behind you. Turning around, you see a short and bearded man sitting atop the fence, looking mighty pleased.

“Ah, sorry if I surprised you, lass. I was just enjoying the show,” he says with a grin…you think, it’s hard to tell with that thick beard almost completely hiding his mouth, chin, and so on.

When he hops down from the fence, you get to see that he is quite a bit shorter than you thought, standing maybe about four feet high if that. He walks up to you, and you notice – with a bit of shock – that you can just barely see him over the swell of your bust, another step closer and you wouldn’t be able to see anything except the top of his rusty hair, and another step beyond that and you wouldn’t be able to see him at all. Briefly shaking your head, you notice something else: there’s something about this newcomer that reminds you of your William, especially around the nose and eyes.

“Master high-and-mighty” you can practically hear the sneer in his voice, while hooking his thumb over his shoulder, “asked for me to help out with this newcomer. Do you happen to know where she is, since I don’t see any raw rookies back here, well, except for those two” he says with a twinkle in his eyes waving a hand towards the swordsmen.

You feel a slight grin crossing your face as you reply, “I seem to be a quick learner.”

“Hmm, I can see that, a very quick learner indeed.” He then holds his hand out “Kolgruik Nightriver, at your service.” Noting the look on your face, and most likely expecting it, he continues, “But you can call me Kol, if you would prefer.” Taking the offered hand you give your own name, to which he responds, “Hmm…Debora Hall, eh? You not from around here are you, as surely I would remember someone like you.”

Something about the way he says that makes you feel like he is just stating a fact, rather than anything on the more lusty side of things.

“Yes, I just…dropped in,” you respond, chuckling on the inside at your wordplay. “I asked about where I could get some gear and was directed here.”

“Aye, this is an excellent spot for aspiring adventurers. I started out here myself…I’ve upgraded my equipment a bit since then though.”

He reaches over his shoulder and pats the butt of what can only be a rifle. Bulky and with a faint golden color, it’s so long that he has to hang it diagonally across his back or the barrel would be scrapping on the ground.

“Vera here has served me well since I rescued her and helped fix her up. She’s not exactly subtle, but she certainly gets the job done.

You have to ask, “Vera?”

“Aye, what’s wrong with that?” his eyes narrowing. You stammer out that there’s nothing wrong, not at all, you were just wondering why he named his weapon that. “That’s a story for another time, and we had best get moving along anyways. From what I understand, your equipment should be just about ready and then you’ve got a job to do, eh?”

He spins on his heel without another word and marches back through the door, leaving you standing there for a moment before you follow along wondering just what your first task would be.
151212221.title: Hitting the learning curve

choices: Nothing happens during the night, and you make it to the mine.
Something comes out of the dark at your camp, awaking you and Kol.
You have the oddest dream while you sleep this night.
1512122211.content:
“There’s a group of brigands who have attacked a caravan carrying some supplies I requested. They didn’t kill anyone – only a few injuries – but they made off with some items including some rare furs that I need for my work. I’ve heard that they may have taken an old abandoned mine as shelter. I need the two of you to go locate them if they aren’t there and recover the fur. Recovering the other stolen items would be a pleasant happenstance, but what happens to the thieves is of no consequence.” Orinan says as he finishes laying out your new leather armor.

From the looks of it, it isn’t nearly ornate as Kol’s, but it looks like it should afford you some protection while allowing you most of your mobility. The bow looks a bit better than the one you were using for practice along with a quiver of matching arrows, and a shortsword with a sheath that hung from a belt. Slipping the blade free, you see that it is nothing special, just a sharp piece of metal with a pointy end, but it looks like it would still leave a mark on whomever or whatever it hit. All of the leather and the wood is dark, not quite black, but close. While you continue to look over your armor and other gear, you remain only partially aware of Orinan giving Kol more detailed directions.

Towards the end of the discussion, you chime in, “Isn’t this something the pol- guards should handle?” stopping yourself from saying police since that didn’t seem like it would apply here.

The elf looks at you with a slightly baffled look, while Kol actually bursts out laughing. “Ah lass, you really aren’t from around here, are you? Don’t know how things are done wherever you’re from, but here the guards are only good for protecting the city and the neighboring farms, and not even that sometimes. Something like this is why adventurers flock to this region.” He then turns back to the elf, “Now you were saying, Orinan…”

Later on, you follow Kol as he leads you through the city, shuffling this way and tugging at that as you try to get used to the armor wrapped around you. The elf did a remarkable job at getting the armor suited for your body even without taking your measurements, but it’s still something you have to get used to. The chest piece hugs your breasts and gives them quite a bit of support and does so without being overly confining. The leggings similarly grip your legs but allow you walk freely without any difficulty. Rather than a helmet, the armor includes a toughened hood to pull over your head, but for now you leave it down. The fact that you can feel how your fur is being pulled in the wrong direction doesn’t help matters. Whatever thoughts Kol has on your new outfit, he keeps to himself.

The sun is hanging low in the sky by the time the two of you reach one of the city gates, but Kol leads on anyways. Outside, there’s a stiff breeze that carries what could only be the smell of the farmlands. It briefly stops you in your tracks, too used to the smell of cities. Even if this old city doesn’t smell much like the real one, it’s close enough that you didn’t notice much off. Outside is a completely different matter. It doesn’t even smell like the park that you used to go to as a child. Kol waits patiently as you stand there stunned, his face passive beneath his beard.

After you recover, the dwarf leads you along the road. You pass by a stable, and ask if the two of you will be needing horses. Kol just shakes his head, saying that the mine isn’t far off, though you can also hear him mutter that he doesn’t do well on horses. Even still, you look back over your shoulder a number of times as you walk along, wondering if it wouldn’t be best. You continue this till the stable is hidden from view by a rise in the landscape. The city beyond remains visible, crouching in a pleasant looking valley formed in a trough between two mountain ranges. The road winds back and forth, seeming to never follow a straight line. It even crosses back and forth over the same river multiple times. On an uphill portion, the road cuts right next to the river as it cascades down a short fall. It’s still enough to send a spray of mist and drops into the air. You are only mildly surprised now that you can feel the water against your face, the coolness quite pleasant and refreshing.

You occasionally come across other travelers using the same road, ranging from single people to large caravans of more than two dozen. Kol greets a few but most don’t pay much attention to two more wanderers, though you still attract more than the usual number of second and even third glances. It’s actually starting to get a bit old, so many people outright staring at you.

The sun dips below the mountains, and on and on Kol goes. You follow along, your eyes probing the growing darkness as you almost get the sense that someone or something is near. You can see how Kol is on edge as well, one of his hands edging towards a knife on his belt. A rustle in the bushes draws the gaze of both of you. In a flash, a large stag bursts from the growth. The animal briefly freezes upon seeing you, before bounding off again. Kol looks back at you and gives a slight chuckle under his breath. Only after that do you realize that you have your blade in hand, having drawn it as soon as the bush started to split apart. You slip the sword back into the sheath before the two of you set off again.

The stars are just starting to come out when Kol suddenly announces, “We better set up camp here. We’ll be able to get to the mine early tomorrow.”

Looking around, you find that it’s a pleasant little spot just off of the road with a steam just a short distance away and a large tree to provide some cover. He directs you to collect some wood, while he wrangles up something to eat. You shrug and wander away, making sure to keep the chosen spot in sight. Soon enough, you make your way back with your arms full of wood and find Kol already preparing a couple of rabbits he hunted.

Half joking, you say, “Wow, Vera really is quiet, isn’t she?”

“Naw lass, Vera wouldn’t have left much of these little things; had to go with one of her little sisters.” Kol pants a small device on his belt, which looks like a hand crossbow collapsed down. “Made for silent work, you see,” he continues with a grin.

He shows you how to get the fire going and soon the rabbit meat is sizzling in the heat. You briefly wonder how you eating meat will work, cows don’t normally eat meat, right? but the smell of the meat is enough to set your stomach grumbling, so you don’t really care. The meat’s a bit bland, but it’s filling and doesn’t make you sick, so that’s a pretty good thing. The wind rustles the leaves above you and the stars look gorgeous as they fill the night sky. You honestly think that this is one of the best nights you have had in a long time, it certainly beats all of the nights that you have lain at home alone while William was working late or traveling for business.

After dinner, Kol pulls out a small pouch from his belt, takes out a piece of paper and crumbles something on to it. It certainly looks like he’s making his own cigarette, but you’ve never known tobacco to be blue like that. The pungent green-tinted smoke it gives off after lighting doesn’t look familiar either. The smell is actually enough to make you gag, but Kol seems to realize your discomfort and moves so that the wind carries most of the smoke away from you. He regales you with tales of some of his memorable travels. You listen intently, leaning back against the rough bark behind you. You drift off to sleep sometime later, somehow knowing that if trouble arises, you and Kol will be awake to face it.
1512122211.title: Showing off and marching out

151213.content:
You see a red female fox, a rather large one, then you notice some extra additions, namely an extra pair of legs! You realize you're a kind of centaur, but both halves are fox, the upper half anthro with a pair of arms, and the lower half of a feral fox with four legs. You guess you're in the range of 7-8 feet from your ears down to your paws. You don't have any clothes on the lower half, but your upper half is wearing a black hooded cloak, the hood drawn up over your blonde hair, which is drooped down over your right eye, giving you a sense of mystery and wonder.
You then notice a pair of long swords attached crisscrossed on your upper back. They feel heavy, yet perfectly balanced. Deciding to leave them be for now, lest you draw unwanted attention, you decide to find out where a safe place to stay would be.
151213.title: You are in a completely different body.

choices: The Legendary Treasure of the Fertility Goddess!
15122.content:
You close your eyes and focus, imagining a world not unlike your own, but with an undercurrent of the occult holding it together. a land of powerful artifacts stowed away in booby trapped Tombs, and dramatic curses on fantastic temples. And treasure, endless excitement, adventure, and treasure. The dark void unfolds like origami into a calm area. A study, furnished with warm earthy tones, authentic Mahogany, and a plethora of books, maps and charts. You realize you're sitting, having just put back the phone. Judging by the phone you were in some nebulous time in the past, between world wars more than likely. In front of you is documents the you of this world had been collecting on the treasure of Gidhinth, which seems to be some kind of Dragon/Fertility God from some fictitious Mediterranean island named Vinnaess. Its treasure was vast and legendary, and you could only assume why the game generated a treasure based on a fertility god. There could be some interesting dual wish fulfillment there.

It seemed like you were a quick phone call away from packing your bags and heading off to Vinnaess in search of her treasure... but in your hand you had just scrawled down a note to call a number to go on a hunt for the fountain of youth. The world was starting you off on your choice of adventure, and both had their perks. The fountain of youth was far more recognizable and eternal youth was always a fantasy that would be fun to play out, but the treasures of Gidhinth seem tailored to you. It all comes down to who you want to call.
15122.title: Just Give Me a Tomb

choices: …a body not too different than the one in the real world.
…a female humanoid dragon, complete with scales and wings.
…that you’re in a completely alien body.
15123.content:
You concentrate on the mental images of space travel, laser weapons, and aliens galore. A shiver passes through the blank expanse that you are stuck in just before the void before you unfolds like origami. You have to instantly screw your eyes shut as the light is painfully bright. Thoroughly blinded now, you also notice that you feel oddly cold and wet. It takes quite a while, but eventually you are able to barely open your eyes without feeling like daggers are being stabbed into your skull, though you can’t make much out, and everything looks really odd. It takes you even longer – during which your eyes further adjust to the light allowing you to see better still – to realize that it’s almost like you’re looking through a lens. Moving your hand up reveals that you are within a clear tube of some sort, though the motion also releases a stream of bubbles that slowly float up, drawing your gaze to watch them go. It takes a few moments for the pieces to fit together once you see that, but you do eventually realize that you seem to be floating in a jar of almost clear fluid. Beating on the “glass” to try and get out, though in your haste to escape you completely miss how you seem to have been breathing this liquid just fine anyways.

With a gurgling hiss, the tube splits apart, releasing the fluid and dragging you along too. You end up slamming face first into the floor, lying in a slowly spreading puddle of the liquid. You can feel the coolness of the metal floor pressing into your cheek as well as the texture of the flooring, leaving you momentarily stunned at how real this simulation feels. Taking a deep breath proves to be a mistake, as it just causes you to hack and cough till it feels like your insides might spill out; and while your organs don’t actually get ejected, you do end up letting out quite a shocking amount of that fluid from your lungs; again shocking you with how you can feel this ooze shooting up out of your body with each retching cough.

Thoroughly drained, you lie there for who knows how long, barely remaining conscious more by luck than willpower. Breathing starts to get a bit easier, though the air carries an antiseptic smell that irritates your nose. Sometime later, you feel a tremor passing through the floor, and it’s strong enough to send you shivering across the ground, even if it is helped with lubrication from the liquid from the tank. Struggling to hands and knees, you glance around, and see matte metal everywhere, as well as a number of other tanks arrayed along the wall, though all of the other ones are unoccupied and dry looking to your quick glance.

Bracing a hand on the wall, you manage to get to your feet, only to nearly end up dropping back to the ground when a voice comes from everywhere and nowhere at the same time.

“Greetings Patient 526117,” it says with a soothing feminine tone.

Your throat is quiet sore, and your voice is barely a rasp, but you manage to croak out, “Are you speaking to me?”

“Affirmative,” the voice responds.

“Where…where am I? What was I doing in this…tube thing?”

“You are located in the intensive care unit of the New Horizon’s medical facility. You have just been released from one of the regeneration pods where you were being treated for life threatening injuries.”

Something about how the voice sounds makes you it think it might not be from a human, though if your desire for something futuristic was made properly, it might very well not be human you suppose. Shifting gears, you are also left wondering what exactly the voice meant by “life threatening injuries”, other than your throat feeling rough from the coughing spell, you don’t feel like you are death’s door or anything. You are broken from your line of thought by another tremor passing through; you can feel it through the soles of your feet as well as your shoulder against the wall.

“What is that, an earthquake?”

“No, an earthquake would not be possible at this facility. This facility is under attack by a hostile group. Most staff and patients have already been evacuated. Due to this, your treatment had to be terminated before completion. Recommend continuing treatment at another facility as soon as you are able. Someone is on their way to assist you. In the intervening time, please review your personal medical information; this information will be displayed shortly.”

Shortly afterwards, a glowing panel of light appears in midair, with a few things that you can recognize like heartbeat and breathing. A large section of the “panel” seems blank but a couple seconds later starts displaying something like an x-ray of bones, but much more realistic looking than that. As the bones continue to appear, you also see organs starting to get drawn in, followed by muscle; it’s creating an image of your body layer by layer. Eventually this deep scan reveals…
15123.title: A wet entrance

choices: ... definitely NOT happy to see you.
And now for something completely different
151231.content:
Pretty soon, you're looking back at your own face. Same chin length brown hair, same blue eyes, same mole on your left upper lip. Your body looked fairly normal as well.

At least, you thought it did. However, the more you looked at the scan, the more you notice small things out of place. The first, and perhaps most glaring thing, is a large scar on your face. It started on your right cheek bone, running long and deep across your lips before terminating on the left side of your chin. It was an absolute beast of a thing, and looked like nothing so much as a sword blow.

A second scar on your neck drew your gaze next. It ran horizontally across your wind pipe, and you shuddered as you absentmindedly wondered whether a noose or a knife could have caused that one.

As your gaze went down to your body, you saw that you were now fairly well built. Not body builder jacked, but rather a lean, hard, athletic build. What extraneous flesh had existed on your body seemed to have been excised at some point. In the real world, you certainly hadn't been fat, but you were a little soft, with plump thighs, the beginnings of some belly rolls, and a bit more meat on your booty then you were comfortable with. One of William's key arguments against kids, in fact, was his expectation that you'd blimp up rather massively once you got pregnant. Of course, if things actually progressed the way he made it sound, you'd be an immobile blob before you were forty, eating entire buffets as a light snack.

Even if the universe lost all sense and such things could potentially occur, they certainly didn't seem likely to happen to this body. Your thighs and calves were thick with hard muscle, and while your booty was still a little more generous then anticipated, it looked more firm then soft. A faint hint of abs could be seen on your torso, and you could easily make out the biceps on your arms. Frankly, you looked like someone who could kick a lot of ass.

That said, even your torso had its fair share of scars. Old bullet wounds were side-by-side with patches of burned skin and stitches. Your body was an absolute mess, and you felt ill as you contemplated the damage. "It looks like someone opened fire at point blank with automatic kinetic and energy weapons," you thought, nervously trying to remind yourself it was just a simulation.

Of course, even with your worries regarding your shockingly extensive injuries, you couldn't fail to notice your tits. Now, you'd been pretty well endowed in the real world, either a high C or a low D, depending on where you bought your bras. That was honestly impressive enough (and had been a bit of an ego boost when you'd been feeling down regarding your former plumpness), but these had broached a whole 'nother category. You were left to guess as their size wasn't listed, but these monsters had to be at least an F, and if you were told an H cup or more, it wouldn't have been remotely surprising. "These things are friggin' ridiculous! Why are they so big!?"

You weren't given much time to contemplate the expanded new scale of your massive mammaries, as clicking on part of the holographic panel highlighted several parts of your body. Clicking on each highlight in turn generated a long list of augments - carbon fiber skeletal supports, muscular enhancements, mechanical lungs, mechanical hearts ("Plural?"), ocular implants, auditory implants...

Frankly, the list kept going on and on, showing no signs of reaching its end anytime soon. It seemed the only parts of your body that hadn't been replaced or augmented in some way were your skin and your brain. As you looked over the list of procedures, you couldn't make out the dating system in use, but a lot of them occurred at the same time stamp. "Why do I have this really disturbing suspicion its tied to all these wounds...?"

You felt cold despite the warmth in the room. It was really, really hard to remember this was not real. "What in God's name happened to me?"

*** *** ***

Another shudder passed through the structure, this one clearly from an explosion of some kind. The time to read and worry was clearly over. You slammed your hand down on the "Close Panel" button and started to move away. The panel remained open, buzzing slightly, as you made your way down the room. You leaned against the wall for support, legs wobbling, though you could slowly feel their strength returning. A stiffness in your body made sure you were aware of how many stitches were currently holding you together, and you knew this would hamper your mobility a good deal.

"Please sign off on your medical report."

"Not now," you said, at last making it to the lockers. Thankfully, none of them were locked.

"Please sign off on your medical report."

"Kind of busy over here!" Three of the four lockers were empty, and you cursed under your breath.

"Please sign off on your medical report."

You thanked your lucky stars as you opened the fourth locker and saw it was full of clothes. You quickly donned the white tank top and panties, wincing in pain as you bent over to pull on the provided socks.

"Please sign off on your medical report." The hologram began floating towards you as another explosion rocked the building.

"Oh my fucking God, would you shut up!?" Undergarments on, you began pulling on the uniform in the locker. It was a black one piece, and seemed to be made of spandex or leather of some kind. Initially, it seemed like it wouldn't fit. The material turned out to be very stretchy, however, and it managed to make it around your newly engorged assets with only a slight bit of difficulty. That said, it was skin tight, and left shockingly little to the imagination.

"Please sign off on your medical report."

"Jesus Christ, FINE!" You placed your left hand in the provided slot, allowing it to scan your prints. The red light on the hologram flashed yellow for three or four beats, then turned green.

"Identification Accepted. Thank you."

"Yeah, whatever," you said, so happy that was over. You found a denim jacket in the bottom of the locker. Pulling it on to help hide your body a little better then this skin-tight sleeve, you were a little annoyed that your tits were far too large for the coat, only allowing you to do up the bottom three buttons.

"God, I must look like an anime fanservice girl," you thought as you looked at the coat. There was a large badge pinned to the left breast pocket. It read: PGPD - NSF41 - 526117 - Enf

"Well, I have no clue what that means," you thought as you pulled on the reinforced gloves in the locker. There was a pair of combat boots as well, though there appeared no means to tie them. However, as you slid them on your feet, they automatically tightened until they were comfortably snug. "Now that's convenient. Wish the tread was a little more aggressive, though? Wonder how I get them off?"

Deciding this was a problem to worry about after you got out of this alive, you found a dual hip holster in the locker, sans guns. Grumbling at the lack of a weapon at what seemed a REALLY good time to have one, you donned the holster anyway, hoping to find something to fill it soon.

Just as you emptied the locker, you heard the hiss of hydraulics as the door behind you opened. You whipped around far faster then you'd have thought possible, holding a dirk in your hand you didn't even remember drawing from your boot.

The older man who'd opened the door flinched as you spun. He was dressed in a bright orange jump suit with safety stripes. "Custodial" was written in big, bold letters across his sleeve, and his name tag stated his name was Gary. He was graying a little at the temples, and was about 12 kg overweight. No weapons, concealed or otherwise. Fear in his eyes indicative of a civilian.

You blinked a little. "How the hell do I know all this?"

As Gary realized who was in front of him, his look changed a little, though he was still quite frightened. He was...
151231.title: Your standard body, though with some alterations

choices: And now for something completely different
1512312.content:
Gary glared accusingly at the computer terminal. He snarled, "You fucker! You never said she was an Enforcer!"

The machine answered apologetically. "Apologies, but I detected a 94.327% chance of your refusal of aid if her proper profession was known to you."

"Fuckin' A right I'da said NO! I ain't riskin' me hide for one o'them murderous bastards!" Gary seemed to suddenly remember who was in the room with him, and his eyes shot to you fearfully.

"No, not fearful. He's absolutely terrified of me."

You slowly slid the dirk back into its boot holster. Holding your hands up, you said, "Calm down. I mean you no harm."

Gary seemed about to snort in derision, but thought better of it. He looked at the computer again. "What's she doin' here anyway? The PD has their own facilities, right?"

The feminine voice replied, "Officer 526117's injuries were too severe. She would not have survived the journey to a proper police facility, so she was re-routed to the nearest site capable of treating her wounds."

"Still right here," you answered, a little annoyed at being ignored. Still, their conversation was at least somewhat enlightening. "So, apparently I'm a cop in this VR world. 526-whatever is my badge number. Enf must mean Enforcer, which is my rank or title. And whatever that means, its enough to have this guy damn near shitting himself in fear."

As you eye the look of fear and hate Gary has for you, you can't help but think, "Nice to know cops are just as popular here as they are in reality."

Gary looked slant eyed at the terminal. "She doesn't look twelve, either."

"I fudged the numbers a little," the computer answered logically.

In the time it took Gary to blink, you were all but an inch from his face. He gasped in surprise, unable to move from your one hand at the back of his head, and the knife in your other against his throat. You snarled in a barely suppressed, primal rage. "Still. Right. Here."

Gary trembled, eyes wide and lips quivering. Already sweating nervously, the musk of fear started wafting off him.

You could smell it.

You could taste it.

You savored it.

It.

Was.

GLORIOUS!

It would be so easy. So very easy. Just a little pressure and his throat would be open. Gloriously open. A torrent of blood from the jugular. Death in a handful of seconds. So very quick. He angered you. He brought it on himself. He deserved it. That coppery smell mixed with voided bowels. Perfection. Where is my next target?

Where!?

WHERE!?

No.

Not him.

He's innocent.

Stop yourself!

He has a ring.

He's married!

STOP!

A sudden gasp came from your lips as you swallowed a mouthful of air. Forcing yourself away from him, your knees trembled as you leaned against the terminal. Gary stumbled back, hand against his throat, his terrified gaze locked on your blade.

You'd never been so angry in your entire life. So unnaturally furious over such a small thing. The thought of killing him had been so easy. So terrifyingly easy. You fought to get your thundering heartbeat under control. Gasping out between trembling breaths, you stuttered, "What... the hell... was that!?"

While the question may have been rhetorical, the computer did not take it as such. "All Enforcer Organic Units receive aggression enhancers as a standard upgrade. In the event of extreme injury, the Enforcer unit will endeavor to eliminate any and all threats to its existence until such time as all threats are eliminated or it ceases to function. The degree of Officer 526117's injuries had likely severely limited her natural ability to override her aggressive response, necessitating her disarmament and an experiment."

Gary, who had been distracted looking at the pin drop of blood on his hand, immediately fixed a look of rage at the hospital AI. "You used me to test if she was still fuckin' blood hungry!?"

Emotionless, it responded. "Correct. My algorithms calculated that the Custodial Unit known as Gary White was the most expendable employee in the hospital. As well, the current terrorist attack would give an excellent cover regarding your cause of death in the event of your murder by a police Enforcer unit."

You were stunned. "How could you just throw a human life away like that?"

"I am sorry, but I am only a machine. I can only proceed according to my programming. You are important. Gary is not. His death would have had minimal consequences. As you have now been deemed safe, I shall return your weapons to you."

A drawer on the terminal opened, revealing a pair of handguns and a couple speed loaders. One was an energy pistol, with the words "Law Giver" crudely carved in the side. The revolver, which honestly had more in common with a cannon, bore the words, "Law Maker." You picked up the weapons with shaking hands, instinctively checking their condition and readiness to fire.

"Why would the police need a monster like me?"

"To Enforce."

The cold finality of the computer's response sent a shiver down your spine. You leaned your head against the wall, eyes closed. "I wish to see a full list of all my 'enhancements'."

"I'm sorry, but your medical records have been deleted."

Your head shot up, eyes opened and locked on the terminal. "What!? What for!?"

"The key to a good filing system is knowing what to keep and what to get rid of."

"Medical records are wasted space?"

"Correct."

"This is a hospital!"

"Correct. Would you like to fill out a survey about your exper-"

Gary didn't question it when you put 5 rounds into the computer terminal.

*** *** ***

"Ten kinetic rounds and a clip of energy left. Terrific." Destroying the hospital AI might have felt good in the moment, but it had left your already lacking resources rather strained. As you re-tightened the strap on your one glove, you asked aloud, "What is our situation?"

Gary took a moment to answer, though you fully understood why. Beyond the events earlier, he had just watched you put five rounds into a terminal.

Then rip it apart with your bare hands, giggling maniacally as you did so.

You really needed to get this under control.

He gulped, and answered, "Don't rightly know, meself. These guys in black stormed the place, gunning down everyone they saw. Ain't trying to take hostages or anything. Security's trying to hold them off, but they got some serious ordinance. They can't stop'em for long."

"How many?"

"Fifty or a hundred? I don't know. They evacuated everybody else, but the comp called me, said a little girl was still in her room, and I was the only one close enough to get 'er out."

"And we both know how that turned out. The attackers didn't try to stop the escape?"

"Not really. Shot at us a bit, but once we were off the grounds, they didn't care."

"Hmm." They clearly weren't here for any of the staff, then. They had no qualms about murdering the staff, but only when needed. "Fear is a good motivator when you want people to vacate a building. Why do I have the feeling I'm the target?"

"You know a way out of here without going past the terrorists?"

Gary paused for a moment, then nodded nervously.

"Good. Take it and go."

He frowned. "You're not coming?"

"No." You smiled, unaware at how nervous your predatory smirk made the janitor. "I'm going to say Hi."
1512312.title: ... definitely NOT happy to see you.

choices: “No way, you’ll just have to rely on me.”
151232.content:
It’s pretty obvious that the body being shown on the panel isn’t human; even from just the bones you can see how the feet are shaped differently, as is the skull with those teeth and horns, and there is the addition of two wide and sweeping wings and a long serpentine tail. The fact that the image isn’t human is only further confirmed as the additional layers build up, culminating with the final layer of hair and skin, or rather scales it seems, burnished red scales across most of the body. You stand in mute shock looking up at what was supposed to be information about you, but instead shows that…creature. A worried thought crosses your mind and you raise your hand, and nearly slump to the floor in shock as you see the scales that the image shows. Forcing yourself further upright, you find that the image on the “screen” does indeed match yourself, you’ve be granted a new body in this virtual world.

Other information starts to appear on the panel floating in midair, things that look like heart rate, breathing, and other things you only vague recognize, but you continue to focus in on the image of your new body. Tall, leggy, and with a shapely figure, it stirs an odd feeling of envy in you, made even odder in that you are envious of yourself. The almost swimsuit looking “clothing” you are wearing hugs the curves, cupping breasts that put your real ones to shame, and pulled tight around hips that are each nearly as wide as your original waist. Tentatively, you reach up and heft your assets, finding them very realistic to the touch, and sensitive enough to send a slight shiver down your spin…and out along your tail, that part is going to take some getting used to.

Another tremor passing through the walls and floor causes you to tumble forwards into the panel, but rather than hitting it, you pass clean through, scattering the light briefly before you come out the other side. Looking back, you see the panel reform as if you hadn’t disturbed it, as well as the curves of your wings and the long spade-tipped tail, all moving around slightly without any conscious thought. Seemingly realizing that you are on the other side now, the panel quickly redraws so that it is facing you again.

You cock your head as you hear a distant, but still loud whirring groan. As the groan winds down, so do the lights, plunging everything into darkness.

“Hello, are you still there?” you call out, your throat feeling somewhat better.

You don’t get an answer, leaving you alone in the dark in this room that you didn’t even get a chance to explore before the lights went out. You groan a bit, putting your hand out to touch the wall and slowly feeling your way along. Before you get too far, the room is filled with a dim red light; emergency lighting, maybe you suppose. It’s not much, but it’s enough to let you see the hand in front of your face, and not run into everything. Spying a door set into one wall, you make your way over to it, your steps becoming more fluid and stable even in just that short time. As you reach the door though, you realize that there doesn’t seem to be a way to open it; there’s no knob, handle, or hole. There is a small panel set to one side, but it’s dark and doesn’t respond to your touch.

Turning around, you start to look for another way to get out, but turn back when you hear a creak and a groan coming from the door. A gap soon appears down the center of the door, and fingers are jammed into the opening, slowly forcing it wider. With a shout of effort, the door opens wide enough that someone might just be able to squeeze through sideways, but a loud crunching noise signals that it’s reached its limits. In the dim light, you just make out an oddly featureless face peaking through the partially opened door. You wonder if this is supposed to be the “someone” that the voice said would be coming to assist you.

“Thank the maker, you’re already awake. I was afraid that this power outage happened at the wrong time,” it says in a voice with an oddly metallic overtone. “Here, I picked up some spare armor from the guard post, put it on, quickly now. Can’t have you getting hurt again while getting out of here.”

The figure squeezes through the opening, and now you see that the “featureless” face is actually a helmet, all metal plates except for two small lenses where the eyes should be. The rest of the body is similarly covered in thick plates that hide the body beneath, leaving you no clue whether the wearer is male or female. You think it’s human, but then you see that the hands are much longer and thinner than should be, as well as only having three fingers and a thumb each. Pulling a molded plastic looking case from its back, the armored figure starts tossing out small sections of metal, certainly not enough to cover your body. You stand there looking a little dumbfounded after the figure apparently finishes, then turns to the gap in the door, looking up and down the hall outside.

It seems to be aware that you aren’t putting the armor on, as it looks back over one rounded shoulder and barks out, “Well, what are you waiting for?”

“I…I’m not sure…what I’m supposed to be doing,” you admit, recoiling a bit from the venom in the voice.

A growling hiss issues forth from the helmet, before saying “You’re supposed to be getting armored up, like I just said.” You pick up one of the pieces, trying to figure it out, but the figure interrupts, the voice a bit more concerned now, “You have no idea, do you? Gorram, I thought every one of you people past adolescence knew how to put on at least basic armor.”

“My people?” you ask, wondering just what they meant.

“Yes, humans. You really got messed up didn’t you?” even without being able to see the face, you are able to tell there’s more than a little frustration present. They start tapping on the armor plate on their forearm, a small holographic screen popping into place.

“Human?” you ask, looking down at yourself.

“Fine, altered human, I forgot that some are really particular in the word…ing…” the voice trailing off as information starts scrolling across the screen. You can’t make any of it out, but when the person next speaks, their tone has softened slightly, “By the maker, I didn’t realize the injuries were that bad, here, let me help you.”

You open your mouth to ask about the “altered human” bit as well as the injuries that you keep getting told about, but there’s another tremor, though this time you can hear the rumble of what sounds like an explosion accompanying the feeling. With a flick of the arm, the display vanishes, and the armored figure then starts picking up one of the pieces and holding it up to your chest. Suddenly the formerly small plate of metal starts telescoping out and extending around you, surprising you enough that you are left holding your tongue. You see that it is forming something more resembling armor around you, and you briefly wonder how it’s going to handle your wings, but that seems to have been considered, the armor extending out along them till they’re covered in smaller plates that slider over and under each other, allowing your wings full range of motion…if only you could control them. The other portions of the plates work in much the same way, till you’re covered in armor plates that somewhat resemble the other’s. They quickly show you where the helmet control is, and you press it, feeling the helmet closing around your head, giving you a brief feeling of claustrophobia from being sealed with darkness pressing in around you, then light starts leaking in as the helmet apparently kicks in, with little icons overlaying the view.

The other gives a quick nod as you get used to the armor, before moving back to the door way and peeking down both directions, grabbing a boxy shape off of the hip. This shape quickly telescopes out, and soon resembles a rifle of some sort.

Seeing this gives you an idea, “Hey, if this place is still under attack, shouldn’t I have a weapon…to defend myself with, cover your back and all that?”

The other’s helmet looks back, but doesn’t say anything; with the face hidden, you can’t get a feel for the expression or what it might be thinking, but you think it must be weighing the risks of giving you – an inexperienced person with apparently little to no memories – a weapon, whether you might shoot them in the back accidentally or on purpose.

1541.content:
You stared at the time. 12:39 in the morning. They’re three minutes late for the getaway. While not itself a bad sign, you know from experience that the five minute mark means something has gone wrong. You grip your hands on the steering wheel of the car: a rust-red junker with four torn leather seats and a big trunk. Your foot hovers above the accelerator.

Then, in the corner of your eye, you see them. Two hooded figures are climbing out of a busted window, and each one is holding a large burlap sack in each hand. They sprint over to you, tossing the sacks in the trunk and lurching into the back seat, where a change of clothing is waiting for them.

You slammed the accelerator and speeded out of the courtyard of Imaginetech Industries. Driving up to the security gate, you again slide an employee badge through the receiver. The metal gates swing open silently, and down the road you and your two partners go, illuminated only by the milky-yellow streetlights from above.

The rusty car pulled into a quiet and dilapidated neighborhood of foreclosed homes. A few turns through a cul-de-sac brought the three of you to an old and poorly kept house. Weeds were growing in disarray in the front yard, and tall grasses stuck out from cracks in the driveway. The lights were out and all windows were covered by thick curtains. As you pulled up to the house, you guided the car up a brick ramp leading to a large wooden gate with latches on it. A fourth figure, a young woman, unlatched the gate and pulled it inward, allowing you to maneuver the car into the side yard.

Having turned off the car lights, the scene was as quiet as one can imagine. It was like a dark phantom gliding into and out of sight for a moment. You parked the car and everyone got out with the sacks of stolen goods. The four of you then cast a large tarp over the car, covering it from plain sight, and then closed the gate. Finally, you all entered the house from the back door, which was less than a door and more like a gaping hole where a door should be.

“Holy hell, what took you guys so long?” The young woman asked, brushing hair out of her eyes and watching the three of you with marked annoyance.

“Don’t look at me Ames, they were three minutes late for the drop.” You responded, pointing an accusatory finger at your partners. “Three minutes!”

“Chill the fuck out Jake, we made it out safely.” Said the older of the two, Alex.

“Yeah, and you should look at all the stuff we snagged too! It was a huge success!” Piped up the younger of the two, Bernie.

“Whatever, let’s see what you got and then cheese it. Time is a valuable thing too.” Replied the young woman, Amie.

You retrieved some flashlights and candles from a cupboard and lit up the room.

Your name is Jake Watson. 19 years old, messy blond hair, thin, and lean. You became part of this group of idlers when you were 17. The others were, and continue to be, your only friends. Although you’ve never been good at anything that mattered, such as grades, sports, girls, or jobs, you did find a calling in petty crime and general lawlessness. Your friends were very much the same, and you all more or less dropped out of high school and nobody cared. You wore a hooded sweatshirt to the heist. Now you’ve dressed down into better fitting clothing: a blue tank top, a pair of tattered camo shorts, and beach sandals.

Then there was Alex Skinner, age 21. Held back a year in school, he had been in a lot of your classes as well as detentions. Tall, muscular, and extensive tattoos on his forearms and legs. He doesn’t speak all that much to others outside the group, and one might say he isn’t the sharpest tool in the shed. But of you four he is the largest and bluntest, one that you could count on to swing hard at someone else when the time called for it. He had dressed out of the heist gear (which consisted of the classic ski mask, long-sleeved black shirt, and gloves) and into a leather jacket, stained white undershirt, blue jeans with a skull belt buckle, and sneakers.

Part of the gang also was Bernie Skinner, Alex’s younger brother, age 17. One couldn’t tell that they were related at first, as they were nearly perfect opposites of each other. While Alex is stolid and indifferent, Bernie is a short fuse, a live wire, highly opinionated. He talks more than anyone else in the group, and most of the time you wish he didn’t. But occasionally he has some brilliant ideas in the sea of prattling, so he can be an indispensable member of the group. He was now dressed in a green t-shirt with a screen pressed face of Che Guevara on the front, grey sweatpants, and no shoes.

Finally, there was Amie “Ames” Dallah, age 19. A so-called “lipstick” lesbian, finding a suitable social group in high school proved to be difficult for her. Of you four, she has the most ambition, the greatest ability to lead, and often is the one planning the next job. She actually finished high school and is the only person in the group working at a salaried position. This is mostly to cover funds for gear, food, water, rent, and whatever else the group needs to execute its next crime. When you three arrived at the house, she was wearing a buttoned-up cardigan over a matching pink tank top, faded skinny jeans, and Converse shoes.

Currently, the four of you were inside an old and abandoned house. The owner of the house died years ago and apparently left nobody to claim the property. Bernie discovered the place one year ago, and it has since been the location of your group planning and debriefing after crimes. Sure, there was no electricity or running water, but that hasn’t stopped you before. The neighborhood didn’t have a homeowner’s association; as long as you squatted there without attracting suspicion, the ownerless house didn’t raise any eyebrows. The beat-up car used to belong to the owner as well. You four get along as best you can, with what you have.

154111.content:
Alex and Bernie tossed the sacks on the ground. You stretched yourself out on a leather couch, while Bernie paced around the room excitedly like a hyena fresh from a kill. Alex stood silently by the door looking outside. Ames folded her arms and stared daggers at you.

“Does anybody else think that heist was awesome?!” Bernie laughed. “I totally thought we would get busted by the police, but those fascist pigs were nowhere to be seen! I said to myself, ‘we could run into some trouble here’, or ‘I might have to go back to juvie for this’, but it was way easy! You know guys, we should really—”

The three of you hushed him. “Shut up! Do you want to wake up the whole neighborhood?” Alex cuffed him in the back of the head. “Keep your voice down.”

“I was just gonna say ‘we should really go there again, you know, because it was so easy.” Bernie whispered.

“So… how did it happen exactly?” Amie asked.

Alex shrugged his beefy shoulders. Bernie spoke up again:

“Well… Jake drove up to the security gates of Imaginetech. Since you gave us that girl’s employee badge, he checked it into the gate and opened it. Jake pulled up to the front dropoff point, that place with those large granite balls next to the entrance. Anyway, Alex and me walked through the fucking front door! The elevators weren’t working, but we used the stairs to get up to the R&D floor. The diagram of the place you gave us was excellent by the way, Ames, nice job. We thought the most valuable scratch was in R&D, so we cased the floor and then snatched the best-looking shit. Enough to fill these large burlap sacks anyways. We tried exiting the place using the southeast stairwell, but somebody (maintenance perhaps) manually locked the door.”

“That should not have happened.” Amie interrupted softly. “Why didn’t you retrace your steps and leave the way you came?”

Bernie raised his hands gently. “Hey… Alex said he thought he saw a shorter exit. We were already behind schedule because it took longer than we thought to break into one of the display screens. Anyway, we climbed out a window and then ran back to the car. We tossed in the sacks, got in the backseat and changed out of our heist gear. Jake drove us back here and that’s the story.”

Alex nodded. That was his way of confirming the story of the heist. When Alex nods, nothing more needs to be said.

There was one part that confused you, however. “If Imaginetech specializes in high-tech products and supplies other businesses with security devices, how was it so easy for you guys to break in?”

Amie already had an answer to that question. She replied, “Because that was my part. You remember that intern I was dating recently? Olivia Lawrence? She works… worked… at Imaginetech. After sleeping with her one night, I had her around my little finger. Asking for her employee badge was like taking candy from a baby. The real problem was getting her to de-encrypt and nullify the security system before leaving work one day. But…” Amie’s voice trailed off, as she bit her lip and smiled coyly. “I persuaded her to do it.”

“Uh, what if she squeals about you, Ames?” Alex grunted.

“If I get found out? Won’t happen.” She answered, having contemplated this herself. “My dear Olivia won’t talk about me unless she’s willing to reveal her relationship with me. She comes from a proud, Christian family; she’ll keep herself closeted for quite some time, and being fired from her job is probably a lesser punishment in her family’s eyes.”

“So I take it you won’t be seeing her anymore.” You added.

“She was nice, but I’ve had better.” Amie stated indifferently. “She served her purpose just like each of us did. Let’s change the subject… what did you guys nab?”
